title: concurrency issues when closing dy-sidecars

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
# UPDATE ## Issue The removal of the sidecar si canceled and rescheduled while the removal is under way. Since this is done under a task cancellation, it was very hard to trace the issue. ## How it presents itself Below error is just a side effect. There are issues when the dy-sidecar is closed. The issue is still being investigated as it does not always appear and is a bit hard to reproduce. Somehow the removal of the devices is attempted twice. Since all docker resources have been removed, lots of errors are showing up in the director-v2. Notable side effects: - takes longer to close services - false positives (errors with services, like the traceback reported below) --- # Observed side effect Below is raised after trying a few times in a 1 minute interval. To be noted this happens after lots of other calls have been made to the same address. So I'd say this is unexpected. - Also others seem to be facing this issue https://github.com/encode/httpx/discussions/2167 - Currently running on `httpx==0.23.0` and `anyio==3.6.1`. This error was detected inside `director-v2`. ``` File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/anyio/_core/_sockets.py"", line 186, in connect_tcp addr_obj = ip_address(remote_host) File ""/usr/local/lib/python3.10/ipaddress.py"", line 54, in ip_address raise ValueError(f'{address!r} does not appear to be an IPv4 or IPv6 address') ValueError: 'dy-sidecar_79d1fb7c-1cc6-5dbb-be8a-bfd4a45b6c9c' does not appear to be an IPv4 or IPv6 address ``` Full traceback below

title: GC stopping failed services

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
When GC tries to stop a services which is failed, it will hang there for 1 hour before doing anything else.

When asking the service to be removed, director-v2's scheduler does not check if the service can't be removed any longer (because for example there was an issue while removing it)
This should be skipped.


- related to https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/638

title: Garbage collector not collecting garbage + related

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Which deploy/s?

staging aws (e.g. staging.osparc.io)

### Current Behavior

With the new grafana alert for pending docker services we noticed that aws-staging had an increasing number of pending docker services today, starting from 11am swiss time. The services could clearly be related to e2e / p2e started containers, such as kember, cc, etc.

An investigation of the garbage collector showed that for some hours, from at least 11am until approx. 15:15 Zurich time, no garbage was collected. At 15:15, garbage collection resumed for 1 successful run, clearing the resource load on the machines, but afterwards the GC reported errors again. This can be seen as the characteristic logs-lines `Step 1`, `Step 2`, `Step 3` where missing.
Instead, the garbage collector seemed to be not continuing its garbage collection for 1h intervals multiple times, which hints at this being related to 3600s timeouts in the director-v2, that were reported at the same time. During these 1h "pauses" of the garbage collector, only healthchecks were logged.

Ideally, the garbage collector should in an async fashion continue its garbage removal even if a long running HTTP request has a timeout of 3600s. It is not desirable to have the GC paused and waiting 3600s, as then the resources on the nodes may fill up with orphaned services during this time.

During this investigation, a significant number of errors in both director-v2 and GC related to the dy-sidecar `dy-sidecar_5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073` were noted. This sidecar and the assoc. s4l-lite-web service can be seen to have shut down correctly (as indicated by successful S3 upload and message `🎉 App shutdown completed 🎉`), and the autoscaled node went into a drained state only seconds after the shutdown of the sidecar.

To the best of our understanding, for `dy-sidecar_5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073`, which is our best guess at finding at least one root cause of the GC failure, the timeline is as follows:
- User/Puppetter initiates shutsdown dy-service s4l-lite-web
- director-v2 reports `WARNING:simcore_service_director_v2.modules.dynamic_sidecar.docker_api._core:Skipped labels update for service 'dy-sidecar_5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073' which could not be found.` (time `2023-03-23 15:27:12`)
- dy-sidecar on autoscaled node `ip-10-0-2-157` shuts down successfully (time `2023-03-23 15:27:15`)
- director-v2 reports `ValueError: 'dy-sidecar_5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073' does not appear to be an IPv4 or IPv6 address` (see https://monitoring.staging.osparc.io/graylog/messages/graylog_9/315edc01-c98f-11ed-8b8d-0242ac12001a , time `2023-03-23 15:27:16`)
- director-v2 complains with `ERROR:simcore_service_director_v2.modules.dynamic_sidecar.api_client._base:Request timed-out after 1 attempts with an unexpected error: 'e.request=<Request('POST', 'http://dy-sidecar_5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073:8000/v1/containers:down')>':e=ConnectError('[Errno -2] Name or service not known')`
- autoscaled node goes into drained state (time `2023-03-23 15:27:48`)

Please note that 'dy-sidecar_5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073' was probably not responsible for the GC failure between 11am and 3pm, but had *lots* of errors and cried for an investigation into its errors. It might be unrelated to the GC issue.

In general, it was very painful to establish already this minimal information, as the director-v2 logs are riddled with errors and warnings. I would please ask that the errors of the director-v2 are looked into and handled, soon. 

For example: https://monitoring.staging.osparc.io/graylog/messages/graylog_9/2ee92111-c98f-11ed-8b8d-0242ac12001a (why is an exited container an unexpected container status? It exited with code 0 so this is fine?). 
Furthermore, some warnings dont make sense when reading them during debugging:. This is an entire log from director-v2, what does this mean, what is `Retrying None`? `WARNING:simcore_service_director_v2.modules.dynamic_sidecar.api_client._base:Retrying None in 1.0 seconds as it raised ConnectError: [Errno -2] Name or service not known.`?

For more deep-dives, please check as well: 
- https://monitoring.staging.osparc.io/graylog/search?q=NOT+container_name%3A%2F.%2Atraefik.%2A%2F+AND+%225f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073%22&rangetype=absolute&from=2023-03-23T09%3A09%3A34.276Z&to=2023-03-24T14%3A13%3A44.195Z
- https://monitoring.staging.osparc.io/graylog/search?q=container_name%3A%2F.%2A5f7ea91a-0aff-4eae-9587-8721c195a073.%2A%2F&rangetype=absolute&from=2023-03-23T15%3A11%3A24.886Z&to=2023-03-23T15%3A44%3A54.433Z
- https://monitoring.staging.osparc.io/prometheus/graph?g0.expr=swarm_node_info%7Binstance%3D~%22ip-10-0-2-157%22%7D&g0.tab=0&g0.stacked=0&g0.show_exemplars=0&g0.range_input=13s329ms&g0.end_input=2023-03-23%2015%3A27%3A57&g0.moment_input=2023-03-23%2015%3A27%3A57


CC @matusdrobuliak66 who helped me trace this.

### Expected Behavior

- GC works and collects garbage
- GC does not use blocking functions that will make him idle for 60min 
- There is a graylog/grafana alert for the GC not working, since this requires human intervention
- Director-v2 errors and warnings are addressed (fixed)
- Director-v2 logs are refactored to be more understandable

### Steps To Reproduce

I will add a .zip file with the GC logs, use the redis-commander pw for aws-staging to access the logs. You can also use graylog.

### Anything else?

It pains me to say this but for me, as long as what happened here is not understood at all (and you might be able to see from the description that we really struggled to understand causality due to the large amount of errors), this is for me a blocker to release to production. If garbage collection fails a few times, considering e2e and p2e testing, the resources on the deployments will be used up fully and the platform will become unresponsive. 

I will adjust the v1.51.0 release document to indicate this blocker from my side.

I am available for further discussions and tracing. Things that would resolve this block for me:
- Understanding of why this happened.
- Understanding of why the garbage collector suddenly worked again for 1 run without human intervention.

@pcrespov  I suggest for releases from staging to prod to also check the logs of all simcore services for `Tracebacks` and `ERROR`s in the future, we might be lucky to have caught this in staging since there is some flakiness or randomness involved whether garbage is collected or not.

```

The graylog queries that can be used to check if this happens are:
- `container_name:/.*collector.*/ AND NOT "Error in"` --> Display all non-error loglines, referring to "real" garbage collection
- `container_name:/.*collector.*/ AND "Error in"` --> Display the errors mentioned


Further evidence of garbage collection not working is that in prometheus one can see a s4-lite service running for many days, to observe this use the PromQL querry:
`container_memory_usage_bytes{image=~"^.*[.osparc.io].*/simcore/services/dynamic/s4l-core-lite.*$",name=~"dy-sidecar-b57f4e59-13d0-476d-9954-9855adf657b7.*"}`
Comparison with the redis keys, that correspond to open browser-tabs or sessions, show that there was no session key for the user that owns the project containing this s4l for some days, so the garbage collector should have kicked in:
`redis_key_value{key=~"^user_id=2:.*$"}`


### Expected Behavior

Garbage collection works

### Steps To Reproduce

The GC does not work on aws-prod

### Anything else?

This affects production and may cause it to not run smooth if services accumulate. From my feelings, I would put this on high urgency.

title: ⬆️⚗️ Bump traefik version

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
<!-- Title Annotations:

  WIP: work in progress
  🐛    Fix a bug.
  ✨    Introduce new features.
  ♻️     Refactor code.
  🚑️    Critical hotfix.
  ⚗️     Perform experiments.
  ⬆️     Upgrade dependencies.
  📝    Add or update documentation.
  🔨    Add or update development scripts.
  🔒️    Fix security issues.
  ⚠️     Changes in devops configuration
  🗃️    Migration of database

or from https://gitmoji.dev/
-->

## What do these changes do?

On aws-Prod, we have observed a memory leak for simcore traefik version 2.9.5 . The leak was not present for the ops-traefik (v.2.9.8) or for the previous version of the ops-traefik (v.2.8.3)

After this PR merges, the promQL querry `container_memory_usage_bytes`, `container_blkio_device_usage_total` and `container_memory_swap` will have to be checked to see if the memory leak (which eventually leads to platform instability once traefik runs out of swap memory) persists


Traefik is bumped to https://hub.docker.com/layers/library/traefik/2.9.8/images/sha256-553239e27c4614d0477651415205b9b119f7a98f698e6562ef383c9d8ff3b6e6?context=explore

## Related issue/s

Several brief outages on aws-prod betwwen 11mar2023 and 12mar2023 as observed by freshping / uptime robot.


## How to test

Check if the promQL metrics `container_memory_usage_bytes`, `container_blkio_device_usage_total` and `container_memory_swap`  rise steadily

title: Limit the amount of networks in the created networks

labels.name: t:enhancement
labels.description: Improvement or request on an existing feature

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
Currently the director-v2 and the dy-sidecar will create the following networks:

- project_network (used by all user services in a project to comunicate between each other)
- dy_sidecar_UUID (used by the proxy to send traffic to the ingress container)
- back----end (all user services of are placed here)
- egress-i (connects the target container to the egress proxy)
- with_intenrt (provides internet connectivity to certain containers when internet is blocked)

None of the above have any limits regarding the maximum amount of hosts that should be used for the network. These should be enforced


- https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/638

title: director-v2 shared client connection pool runs out of clients

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
After 17 days of uptime, director-v2 ran out of connections in the pool and got stuck resulting in all sidecars not working any longer.

- https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/638

title: e2e does not really wait for studies to be unlocked

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: e2e
labels.description: Bugs found by or related to the end-2-end testing

body:
When done with the study, the e2e assumes that after 5 seconds it will be unlocked. It does not check the status of the card.

Afterwards the e2e delets the study and it succeeds. This is an issue (https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/issues/3898). The test passes.

On the backend side, the sidecar is still trying to save the state and fails with `Insufficient access rights to write`


### Reference logs

Artifacts https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/jobs/2603016
Logs form sidecar: 
[_dy-sidecar_857aa40c-b5b8-5e07-aa5d-fb3a44b6023d.1.nt86cemvxi3gibb7ovwocswqp_logs.log](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/files/10791542/_dy-sidecar_857aa40c-b5b8-5e07-aa5d-fb3a44b6023d.1.nt86cemvxi3gibb7ovwocswqp_logs.log)

title: A study can be deleted while locked

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

body:
It is possible to delete a study via the webserver API if it is still locked. This should raise an error!

Side effect, the sidecar is still trying to save the study and can fail with `Insufficient access rights to write`.


[_dy-sidecar_857aa40c-b5b8-5e07-aa5d-fb3a44b6023d.1.nt86cemvxi3gibb7ovwocswqp_logs.log](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/files/10791670/_dy-sidecar_857aa40c-b5b8-5e07-aa5d-fb3a44b6023d.1.nt86cemvxi3gibb7ovwocswqp_logs.log)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority

labels.name: t:maintenance
labels.description: Some planned maintenance work

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

labels.name: a:autoscaling
labels.description: autoscaling service in simcore's stack

body:
It was observed that on autoscaled nodes, `dy-sidecar` and `dy-proxy` pair,  sometimes get a `SIGTERM` out of the blue.

I am sure this is not initiated by the director-v2 since it would first try to save the state, push the outputs, before trying to remove both services.

For reference have a look at logs from `67fa84ec-5a78-49b8-8aca-0ce179d84021` AWS prod. It can clearly be seen that the sidecar and proxy receive a SIGERM and shut down.

title: Autoscaling: Filesystem issues for sim4life

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
There is a problem with the filesystem in the docker containers created on a fresh ec2-instance for sim4life. I think it only happens for the first running instance on the node but I am not sure anymore (This needs to be confirmed). The problems surfaces in various cirucmstances:
1. when sim4life starts, it creates a File in `work/workspace/Materials`. I think this happens by copying from the root filesystem into the work volume. This file has zero size and when sim4life wants to read it, it fails. The error message is as follows (the 2 database errors):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33161876/214614161-56921aa1-aef2-4613-95ae-d922e713c5c9.png)

2. When you open the Preferences dialog(via the burger) and close it, we try to save the preferences by first creating a file in the `/tmp` folder (e.g. the root partition) and then moving it to `work/workspace/Preferences/Preferences.h5`

![image (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33161876/214615128-f184ec1b-7062-4df8-8c39-d657a2231d72.png)

3. And lastly, when we auto save a file (after about 5 minutes), the same problem manifests: I think we try to save the file by first creating a temporary one too.

Sometimes, I see error messages like `invalid cross device link` next to above errors. This usually means that a file move operation cannot be done because target and destination are not on the same partition or different harddrives. I have seen this problem before with other servcies aws prod. In that case, reprovisioning the machine fixed the problem. (The root filesystem and all the other mounts in the container do sit on the same partition physically, thats why this cannot be the actual problem).

Last time, there was a weird issue with the kernel on the AMI. (@Surfict, maybe you remember). My guess is, that there is some sort of mismatch between kernel version, docker daemon and the timing of when the filesystem becomes available. We could try to use only one drive on the autoscaling nodes if that makes the debugging simpler.

title: 🐛 Fix/dynamic sidecar with self signed certificates

labels.name: a:infra+ops
labels.description: maintenance of infrastructure or operations (discussed in retro)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:sidecar
labels.description: issue related with the sidecar worker service

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
This allows the director-v2 to pass the docker secret containing a root-CA's public key to the dynamic-sidecars, which will in turn trust encrypted communication with certificates signed by said CA.

This enables the dynamic-sidecar services on a local deployment with custom self-signed certificates.

The docker secret is only passed from the director-v2 to the dynamic sidecars if these env-vars are set:
```
DIRECTOR_V2_SELF_SIGNED_SSL_FILENAME
DIRECTOR_V2_SELF_SIGNED_SSL_SECRET_ID
DIRECTOR_V2_SELF_SIGNED_SSL_SECRET_NAME
DIRECTOR_V2_DEV_FEATURES_ENABLED
```

title: Director-v2 gives up on slow starting dynamic sidecars

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Following on [https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9](https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9) incident in e2e:

- a dynamic sidecar is started by the director-v2 and it takes some time for it to be up and running (>1minute) because of system load
- ~the director-v2 only checks via REST API and only for 7 seconds, and then gives up on sending in the docker-compose specifications~ addressed by https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/3583
- the dynamic sidecar was up after 1 minute waiting forever


1. the director-v2 shall probably first check from the docker engine whether the dynamic-sidecar service is "running" BEFORE sending REST API calls as these are useless, there shall probably be a time constraint, but that is dependent on the cluster load (also if polling the docker engine becomes a problem, maybe we should consider hooking into the docker events - but maybe not right now)
2. once the service is in "running" state, it can be stated that it takes less than 20 seconds for it to be responsive, else it has an issue
3. if that failed, there is the question whether the director-v2 should maybe try again instead of giving up? The e2e waits 60 seconds, which in this case would have probably failed anyway, but still the director-v2 did not even wait more than 7 seconds....

title: Director-v2 does not report a service as failed when the dynamic-sidecar is not responding on startup

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Following on [https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9](https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9):

A service is shown as "Starting...``` in the UI although the director-v2 seems to have given up on starting the service after 7 seconds.

The director-v2 calls into the Docker engine to start a dynamic sidecar and then directly tries to call into the REST API of the dynamic sidecar.
If the sidecar returns healthy, then the director-v2 asks it to start containers using ```POST /containers:up```.

If that healthcheck fails then it appears that it gives up... and does not report the service as FAILED.

Details are in [https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9](https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9)

title: Dynamic sidecar ```POST /containers:down``` entrypoint raises RunimeError if no services were started

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
following [https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9](https://git.speag.com/oSparc/e2e-testing/-/issues/9):

some dynamic sidecars are started and then closed
On closing the study the dynamic sidecar is asked to shutdown the user services.

instead of returning a standard response it raises a ```RuntimeError``` which then triggers a whole lot of issues.
Since nothing was started, it does not make sense to trigger an error on close.

Therefore the ```POST /containers:down``` entrypoint shall be modified accordingly and not raise any error when no service was started. It can maybe issue a warning in the logs but nothing more.

title: Deleting a project does not remove failed dy-sidecars

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Is there a way to clean up all abandoned zombie dy-sidecars with one easy command?

This just happened:
- Today at 10:33 ~40 dy-sidecars on dalco (likely only staging) failed to save their data to S3 (ceph)
- The projects they belong to cannot be found in the pg database, but are referenced in the logs. So the project(s) were likely deleted
- Looking through the logs, I see many of these dy-sidecars are from e2e or p2e tests (Filename `TheNumber.txt` and such)
- Now, we might not care about these failed e2e test uploads, but we surely need to check that there are not 40 dy-sidecars now on dalco clogging the machines

Any ideas how to best tackle this? @GitHK  ?

The specific error was `[simcore_sdk.node_ports_common.file_io_utils:logged_gather(122)]  -  Error in 1-th concurrent task <coroutine object _upload_file_part at 0x7f1b6044a240>: Cannot connect to host ceph-prod-rgw.speag.com:443 ssl:default [Temporary failure in name resolution]` [ https://monitoring.osparc.speag.com/graylog/messages/graylog_195/cb41a5a8-64c7-11ed-b190-0242ac130011 ]

_Issue created from a [Mattermost message](https://mattermost.speag.com:443/_redirect/pl/ok3y4s1m6bbnf8kwu3jemijt4h) *by @mrnicegyu11*._

There might also be a subtle simcore-webserver bug hidden, when reading the logs relating to one of the deleted projects I see the following error in the webserver
```
[0;31mERROR[0m: [2022-11-15 09:28:23,775/MainProcess] [simcore_service_webserver.projects.projects_api:lock_with_notification(1055)]  -  Project [project_uuid='70940bf2-64c7-11ed-b2a1-02420a0b000d'] already locked in state 'prj_states.locked.status='CLOSING''. Please check with support.
```
[ https://monitoring.osparc.speag.com/graylog/messages/graylog_195/da2bb381-64c7-11ed-b190-0242ac130011 ]

I think `projects_api:lock_with_notification` should not be called on an object that is already locked, something probably went wrong there.

This might have to be followed up.

[ in case you want to check yourself https://monitoring.osparc.speag.com/graylog/search?q=%2270940bf2-64c7-11ed-b2a1-02420a0b000d%22&rangetype=relative&from=18000 ]

good info! thx

title: 🐛 Dont add /var/lib/docker/volumes in global docker-compose file

labels.name: a:infra+ops
labels.description: maintenance of infrastructure or operations (discussed in retro)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
In the deployments of simcore, the docker volumes are not mounted in the canonical `/var/lib/docker/volumes` path. Since this path is implictly asumed to be valid by the `services/docker-compose.yml` file in simcore, running the simcore agent on the deployment fails as the path `/var/lib/docker/volumes` does not exist.

This PR fixes this issue by moving the `/var/lib/docker/volumes` mount to the `docker-compose.local.yml` file.

title: Disallow usage of swap memory by containers spawned by the dask-sidecar

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dask-service
labels.description: Any of the dask services: dask-scheduler/sidecar or worker

body:
#### Please approach me if this brief text is unclear, I'll happily explain goals and reasoning 

#### Related: https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/issues/3505

In order to have more controlled behavior on our nodes, we should never allow containers to use swap memory. The default of docker is allowing to use as much swap memory as "regular" RAM memory.

We should in the dy-sidecar always run containers with --memory-swap set to the same value as --memory, and --memory is set to a positive integer.
Then, the container does not have access to swap (see https://docs.docker.com/config/containers/resource_constraints/ )

This relates to the personal resources case, as it will allow for more sane bookkeeping of machine resources. Never using swap memory is a more clear and intuitive first approach than allowing the same amount as RAM memory.

The MR fixing this bug requires a DevOps warning, as the kernel feature for handling swap in cgroups (docker) is not correctly set up on dalco and tip.itis.swiss (aws and master are fine).

CC @GitHK @pcrespov

title: Pending sidecars never closing due to "Insufficient access rights to write workspace.zip"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
On `osparc.io`, see for example `graylog/messages/graylog_179/38a575c7-58a1-11ed-95cd-0242ac12000e`, or query graylog for `"Insufficient access rights to write"`.


There were more than 100 dy-sidecars pending and not closing, due to this error. Most of them are from e2e/p2e. It is unclear why this happens. One theory is that the project associated to the dy-sidecar is deleted by the puppeteer *before the study is closed*. On a brief check of graylog, we could not find `:close` calls in the webserver for the projects belonging to those pending dy-sidecars. Why this would happen is unclear. This needs an investigation. This has only been happening from the 27th of October onwards, which would be consistent with the last update of the director-v2 docker service on `2022-10-27 14:34:55` according to portainer.

CC @pcrespov @sanderegg

A user tried to copy a project on `osparc.io` version 1.37.0. this failed silently (original study unlocked, copy does not show up in the frontend). An investigation showed the following error being logged in the osparc storage microservice:

```
ERROR:simcore_service_storage.s3_client:Unexpected error in s3 client: 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/aiobotocore/response.py", line 53, in read

    raise self._exception
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/aiobotocore/httpsession.py", line 178, in send
    response = await self._session.request(
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/aiohttp/client.py", line 559, in _request
    await resp.start(conn)
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/aiohttp/client_reqrep.py", line 898, in start
    message, payload = await protocol.read()  # type: ignore[union-attr]
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/aiohttp/streams.py", line 616, in read
    await self._waiter
aiohttp.client_exceptions.ServerTimeoutError: Timeout on reading data from socket

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_storage/s3_utils.py", line 60, in wrapper
    response = await func(self, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_storage/s3_client.py", line 267, in copy_file

title: S3TransferError with 400 NoSuchUpload

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body: The following happens when uploading 4 output ports in parallel with the following files (service was a jupyter-math): - (port1) 1 x 1 gb - (port2) 1 x 1 gb - (port3) 1 x 1 gb - (port4) 1 x 1 gb & 1 x 1 mb Note the reply is a 404 and the reason AWS provides is `NoSuchUpload` [here we can find more details](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/ErrorResponses.html) . I've also shared a study on master with you where this happens called `NoSuchUpload Error`. I only managed to reproduce this on master. See error [here](https://monitoring.osparc-master.speag.com/graylog/search?q=container_name%3A%2F.%2Af6ac008f-8d2a-42b6-a28d-6b44bd14be18.%2A%2F&rangetype=absolute&from=2022-10-19T13%3A18%3A18.674Z&to=2022-10-19T13%3A25%3A11.886Z) this is reproducible. It happened after the files were created and when the study was closed. ``` simcore_sdk.node_ports_common.exceptions.S3TransferError: Could not upload file /dy-volumes/home/jovyan/work/outputs/output_1/file:status=404, message=Not Found, url=https://S3_MASTER.com/master-simcore/abba85a2-fdbc-11ec-84f1-02420a6e3acd/0b633351-046b-4242-96ca-c91f2ae7e723/file?partNumber=48&uploadId=2~fB_37iIm_3uiB02-APPf1A-z0hXikP8&X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Credential=4FC34BC6KK7TQEBCBHOA/20221019/us-east-1/s3/aws4_request&X-Amz-Date=20221019T122212Z&X-Amz-Expires=21600&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Signature=2aee03aac6fa9afebba5687a511d8851c99029c557170b5722916d3689b5856b, body=NoSuchUploadmaster-simcoretx0000097b833439d7cc32d-00634fec04-13ab5-default13ab5-default-default ``` - related to https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/723

This happened while trying to upload in parallel 4 ports. I have code to reproduce it. But it only happened once. The ports uploaded but this error was raised. ran localy against minio

title: Services with invalid specs are started

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
On many deployments there are services running who's `service_port` is None. `director-v2` complains because when it asks for the `v0/running_interactive_services` from `director-v0` and it can't parse the message. See extract from logs below. 

```python
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/director_v0.py"", line 160, in get_running_services
    return [
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/director_v0.py"", line 161, in <listcomp>
    RunningDynamicServiceDetails(**x)
  File ""pydantic/main.py"", line 331, in pydantic.main.BaseModel.__init__
pydantic.error_wrappers.ValidationError: 1 validation error for RunningDynamicServiceDetails
service_port
  none is not an allowed value (type=type_error.none.not_allowed)"
```

title: CI fails to deploy to master because it does not push built images to dockerhub

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Last commit deployed in master is ``eeaf834`` 

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5caef818ecad11531cc41364/e4c02cf3-e943-43f4-9408-32743955dc30)

If we look now in dockerhub. Notice how, as expected, the tags change for each commit but the digest remains the same! Try for instance with https://hub.docker.com/r/itisfoundation/autoscaling/tags?page=1&name=master

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5caef818ecad11531cc41364/30dfb6d4-c2d2-4dd4-a19a-c7b7abb75cdb)


My guess is that the problem must be in the ``♻️ CI build times: leverage docker buildx github registry caching and transmit builds to int/sys tests (#3369)``   (``3a93ebb``). 

Somehow the new images do not get pushed to github and therefore it deploys always the same which was simply retagged

title: dy-sidecar: sometimes containers are stuck in "created" state

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
It was observed that often when TN starts his study in AWS that:
- some services are stuck in "Created" state (jupyter-smash and/or iseg)

a workaround (works only for jupyter-smash) is to go to portainer select the container and press the "start" button which makes it starts beautifully.

Why this happens is unclear. 

From quickly scanning the code in [https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/40720c7726f4856f508d59a9eac8d359999b2fe6/services/dynamic-sidecar/src/simcore_service_dynamic_sidecar/modules/long_running_tasks.py](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/40720c7726f4856f508d59a9eac8d359999b2fe6/services/dynamic-sidecar/src/simcore_service_dynamic_sidecar/modules/long_running_tasks.py)
lines 77-80 it can be seen that:
- ```docker-compose up --detach --no-build --detach``` is called
- ```docker-compose start``` is called right afterwards

From the documentation ```docker-compose up --detach``` states that it runs in the background. My question would be when is the control coming back then? is calling ```docker-compose start``` right behind really the way to go?
What about doing in that case ```docker-compose create``` and then ```docker-compose start``` instead? Cause right now it kind of defeat the purpose of using the ```up``` command...

title: failing or pending dy-sidecar are left and never removed even if deleted

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
If a dy-sidecar cannot get enough resources on a node it is pending execution.
what happens then is that the director-v2 will consider that node as failed and then leave it unattended
--> using node resources for nothing and preventing new nodes to start.

NOTE: this happens because of [osparc-simcore#3195](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/3195)

title: sometimes node fails because the database is not uptodate

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
An issue was reported lately where the following error message is seen in the dy-sidecar:
```ERROR:simcore_sdk.node_ports_common.dbmanager:the node id ab5d80c3-b2dd-4436-a68b-869ec1404c6f was not found```

This happens due to the following (historic) problem:
1. User creates a new node in the workbench
  a. webserver asks director-v2 to start the node right away
  b. webserver returns the new node uuid to the frontend
2. frontend updates the project JSON
3. at the next occasion frontend saves the project with the new node (<=5 seconds)
4. webserver saves the project and triggers the copy to the comp_tasks table

If the dynamic-sidecar starts so fast and tries to access comp_tasks table in the meantime, then the problem will appear

title: Computational node fails to upload file

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
## Long story short

A computational node (ascent-runner) failed while uploading the results (it happened at least 2 times). In the frontend (logger) I saw that it failed during uploading (once at ~60%, the other time time at ~90%. If I remember well, the file size was in the order of 100MB.
project_id: f5ec048e-099c-11ed-9335-02420a0b00f3
node_id: 3d5166eb-cfbe-4afe-9b4e-4da6b518cf53

This happened on S3 (osparc.io)

## Expected behaviour

It doesn't fail uploading.

## Actual behaviour

If fails while uploading and the user has to re-run the node (which take quite some time).

I was able to capture some hopefully useful message in Graylog (this happened around 13:00 UTC on 22-07-2022)

```
WARNING:simcore_service_storage.simcore_s3_dsm:Error in 1-th concurrent task <coroutine object SimcoreS3DataManager._update_database_from_storage_no_connection at 0x7f6f58c1f8c0>: The file f5ec048e-099c-11ed-9335-02420a0b00f3/3d5166eb-cfbe-4afe-9b4e-4da6b518cf53/logs.zip  in production-simcore was not found

WARNING:simcore_service_storage.simcore_s3_dsm:pending/incomplete uploads of [['f5ec048e-099c-11ed-9335-02420a0b00f3/3d5166eb-cfbe-4afe-9b4e-4da6b518cf53/logs.zip', 'f5ec048e-099c-11ed-9335-02420a0b00f3/3d5166eb-cfbe-4afe-9b4e-4da6b518cf53/envs', 'f5ec048e-099c-11ed-9335-02420a0b00f3/3d5166eb-cfbe-4afe-9b4e-4da6b518cf53/ascent_results.zip']] removed

WARNING:simcore_service_storage.simcore_s3_dsm:Dangling multipart uploads '[('_dwWRe3Tj5XbpsoFQwDHby4jPDXWHdaFpBCSbeG.RmmefJuTVmEKwctKXcWRCdA0qZhAY9Lw3KHNk4wdrgjlc6csG8wOSjcem0UwS8rZVXboMYhYP3a1RHqVG8ZfrVHb', 'f5ec048e-099c-11ed-9335-02420a0b00f3/3d5166eb-cfbe-4afe-9b4e-4da6b518cf53/ascent_results.zip')]', were aborted. TIP: There were multipart uploads active on S3 with no counter-part in the file_meta_data database. This might indicate that something went wrong in how storage handles multipart uploads!!
```

## Steps to reproduce

Create a node in osparc.io, using the latest version of ascent-runner. Here are inputs I had:

f82ad5e3-f680-4e84-81b1:
Oprhaned state: Sidecar running, idling, no attached dy-service-container
What happened?
Director-v2 fails service observation of this sidecar, with:
- `unexpectedly failed [OEC:140670113173664]`
- `raise DynamicSidecarError(
simcore_service_director_v2.modules.dynamic_sidecar.errors.DynamicSidecarError: Timed out while searching for an assigned NodeID for service_id=vp7nt7o8x4tiqcmwikoyfehcx`

Approx. 23 minutes after this log-message, the dynamic sidecar starts, but stays idling forever. No caddy is found.


Actionable follow-ups:

@GitHK @pcrespov @sanderegg

What happened?

title: 🐛 (⚠️ devops)  Fix validation of DIRECTOR_V2_SERVICES_CUSTOM_CONSTRAINTS: Make it conform to docker specs

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director
labels.description: issue related with the director service

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
<!-- Common title prefixes/annotations:
PREFIX:

  WIP: work in progress
  🐛    Fix a bug.
  ✨    Introduce new features.
  ♻️     Refactor code.
  🚑️    Critical hotfix.
  ⚗️     Perform experiments.
  ⬆️    Upgrade dependencies.
  📝    Add or update documentation.
  🗑️    Deprecate code that needs to be cleaned up.
  ⚰️     Remove dead code.
  🔥    Remove code or files.
  🔨    Add or update development scripts.

or from https://gitmoji.dev/ and https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/blob/master/src/data/gitmojis.json

SUFFIX:
 (⚠️ devops)  changes in devops configuration required before deploying

-->

## What do these changes do?

Allow underscore in DIRECTOR_V2_SERVICES_CUSTOM_CONSTRAINTS in regex validation during container start




Before:
`node.labels.standard_worker==true` --> invalid
`node.labels.standardworker==true` --> valid

Now:
`node.labels.standard_worker==true` --> valid
`node.labels.standardworker==true` --> valid


## (⚠️ devops) 
- make sure the variable `DIRECTOR_V2_SERVICES_CUSTOM_CONSTRAINTS ` on all deployments adheres to the new tighter constraints, which is identical to the docker spec https://docs.docker.com/config/labels-custom-metadata/#label-keys-and-values

title: Bug in dy-sidecar: Failure of target service container should be propagated to frontend, instead is connecting forever

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
If a dynamic-sidecar backed service fails, the frontend will (or might) report the service to be "connecting" forever.

Backstory:
- A dy-jupyter-tensorflow (2.0.0) failed to start, because in the `workspace.zip` were filenames with whitespaces (unrelated but known bug)
- This could be seen in portainer
- At this point, the dy-sidecar is happily idling, and the caddy is reporting repedeated failures to connect to the service

Desired behaviour:
- If a dynamic service container reliably fails (for example due to faulty input data or wrong config), this failure should be propagated to the dy-sidecar, and then to the frontend. The frontend reporting "connecting" is misleading


CC @odeimaiz @sanderegg

body:
Our release workflow creates image tags with underscores in the name (see for example https://hub.docker.com/layers/itisfoundation/dynamic-sidecar/staging-github-staging_diolkos1-2022-06-15--15-04.75ddf7e3fb86944ef95fcf77e4075464848121f1/images/sha256-16bef83f05d3d98c04d901700e6001358441feb2eeb2b5c144530ac7c838c05e?context=explore ). For a proper rollback, these older images of the dynamic-sidecar need to be able to pass the regex check in the director-v2, so they can be used.


Check also here: https://regex101.com/r/TH33ZS/1

title: computational services are always restarting

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
# Issue
Project saving does not properly update the workbench node outputs anymore
Regression since [#3058](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/3058) went in

# Steps to reproduce
- create a sleeper
- run the computations
- press the run button again

# Expected result:
The frontend asks whether the user really wants to restart the computation

# Actual result
--> The computation runs again

This is a big issue when one has several services, some of them might take hours and they must re-run each time.


# Additional:
we should have an integration test to check that this always works

# First root cause analysis
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5c9260c7d76ef51f6b0fe785/df3e0246-cd1c-408d-ab6c-4f76cf0a1db1)
As the image shows, this part of the code was removed and was responsible for updating the workbench from the old project to the new project in ```replace_project``` method in ```projects_db``` module. Since this was purely deleted, now the outputs are reset everytime the project is replaced (PUT = Save call from the frontend). Therefore the director-v2 correctly thinks that the computations must be run.

@elisabettai 
@odeimaiz

title: Incident Report: Consistent 100% CPU load on GPU node, GC fails to clean, (working) GC does not collect dy-services

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
## Long story short

Discovery of issue: 7:50 UTC 21Jun2022
The GPU node on aws-staging (10-0-3-132) was at 100% CPU load, with full memory and swapping. The node-exporter was not providing regular metrics to prometheus anymore. A restart of the docker deamon failed. The node was barely responsive. A chassis reset of the machine was performed. Afterwards, the machine again reached the same, 100% CPU state after some minutes.

## Grafana dashboards:
CPU last 2 days:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/174758304-c4083399-a42a-4590-af0b-f594cb749340.png)
RAM last 7 days:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/174758395-63797d50-b799-48a2-afb2-bc8cb0fe31aa.png)

## GC malfunction
The GC on aws-staging was configured to collect garbage every 30 seconds. A graylog query for "Collecting" or "Collecting garbage" does not yield any results on any deployment (although it should, see: https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/79f866219bf650c5eeb4fcdf8f017319087c92c7/services/web/server/src/simcore_service_webserver/garbage_collector_core.py#L64 ). A query in graylog on aws-staging from UTC 05am-08am on 21Jun2022  for `container_name: /.*garbage.*/ AND message:/.*director.*/` shows that calls from the GC to the director happen only every couple of hours, and the garbage is not regularly cleaned. 
After restarting the GC on aws-staging with `interval=60s`, the GC colelcts garbage again. A very long error message is presented:

'dy-sidecar_fc54afad-2fb1-527e-b6e0-9270d90c6baf'), ('fd8fa12a-c70f-59a8-8548-14d55d642afe', 'dy-sidecar_fd8fa12a-c70f-59a8-8548-14d55d642afe'), ('fe26f855-4d86-5a71-a1a2-4f55bf96e0be', 'dy-sidecar_fe26f855-4d86-5a71-a1a2-4f55bf96e0be'), ('fe61e9dc-4ded-5f18-a504-379876751a75', 'dy-sidecar_fe61e9dc-4ded-5f18-a504-379876751a75')]
```

After the GC runs successfully (restart was necessary for this), the redis locks look "good", i.e. any e2e or p2e testers' keys are succesfully removed. 

However, on the GPU node itself dy-sidecars keep running for pretty much exactly 30 minutes (coincidence?). Then, they die with error code 137, which indicates `SIGKILL` (usually, only due to manual intervention of oom-killer). 

10 minutes after the GC successfully ran, the syslogs show that the node was fully bricked (likely due to CPU at 100% and constant swapping of memory). Between 8:37am UTC and 8:56am UTC no syslogs are written. Then, many kernel panics due to hanging `uvicorn` or `dockerd` instances follow. Afterwards, the docker deamon recovers. The dy-sidecars are not present anymore on the node. On the node, there are still 21 `registry.staging.osparc.io/simcore/services/dynamic/jupyter-smash:3.0.4 ` instances related to (now removed) dy-sidecars running.

Although the CPU load of the node has normalized, the GC again seems to be not running (only logs healthchecks, no actual garbage collection).

## Long story short

Boot-mode not persistent in consecutive starts of a study. I think state is only sent to the backend when study is renamed.

title: dy-sidecar reboot volume/data issues

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
If the dy-sidecar is restarted after it was killed, it will do the following:
- get a new set of volumes
- pull the inputs and outputs once again.

Both of the above actions will cause data loss.

title: Investigate Dask-Scheduler KeyError

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dask-service
labels.description: Any of the dask services: dask-scheduler/sidecar or worker

body:
Querrying our deployments with graylog for `"KeyError" AND container_name: /.*dask-scheduler.*/` shows multiple KeyErrors occuring.

These key errors seem to be related to the dask-sidecar getting into a non-working state on dalco on wed 15/6/22.

@sanderegg wrote:

```
ok it looks like the dask scheduler is unhappy and not recovering. I'll restart it for now.
there were also computational jobs with illegal job_ids
I am not sure if that is a reminiscent of the old computational backend or something else. there is a bug entry already for this. I will check in the other deploys anyway
so restarting the dask-scheduler has fixed the logs issue... 
I[t] looks like the dask-scheduler is not resilient to disappearing clients in some use-case
```

Until there is some clarity on this `KeyError` log, I will not add a graylog email alert for this (since it occurs regularly it seems, semi-daily basis on some deployments)

Please let me know when this issue is resolved, I will then add the email-alert as discussed :)

title: Volume search fails blocked container creation

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
# What happened?

For some reason volumes created by the dy-sidecar are not removed when the service is closed. Usually because of manual intervention or errors when closing the sidecar.

  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/dynamic_sidecar/client_api.py"", line 146, in start_service_creation
    raise DynamicSidecarUnexpectedResponseStatus(response, ""service creation"")
simcore_service_director_v2.modules.dynamic_sidecar.errors.DynamicSidecarUnexpectedResponseStatus: Unexpected response [during service creation]: status=404, body={""errors"":[""Expected 1 volume with source_label='dy-sidecar_ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f_home_jovyan_work_inputs', query returned [{'CreatedAt': '2022-06-14T08:26:42Z', 'Driver': 'local', 'Labels': {'source': 'dy-sidecar_ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f_home_jovyan_work_inputs', 'swarm_stack_name': 'production-simcore', 'uuid': 'ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f'}, 'Mountpoint': '/data/volumes/6d71d6db6027de2ed1816914abc1b07e76e716c5a257be3ca61222d2e2a37f3b/_data', 'Name': '6d71d6db6027de2ed1816914abc1b07e76e716c5a257be3ca61222d2e2a37f3b', 'Options': None, 'Scope': 'local'}, {'CreatedAt': '2022-06-14T08:26:48Z', 'Driver': 'local', 'Labels': {'source': 'dy-sidecar_ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f_home_jovyan_work_inputs', 'swarm_stack_name': 'production-simcore', 'uuid': 'ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f'}, 'Mountpoint': '/data/volumes/0fa11cfe4c671feb5b8c94d8dde495bfb9c4ca53811e4b047c2e150ad7b55d72/_data', 'Name': '0fa11cfe4c671feb5b8c94d8dde495bfb9c4ca53811e4b047c2e150ad7b55d72', 'Options': None, 'Scope': 'local'}]""]}"
```

The dy-sidecar is trying to find the volumes using the `uuid` label. Since these is a volume pending from a previous session, it is not possible to determine which one to use.

```python
[{
'CreatedAt': '2022-06-14T08:26:42Z',
'Driver': 'local',
'Labels': {
	'source': 'dy-sidecar_ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f_home_jovyan_work_inputs',
	'swarm_stack_name': 'production-simcore',
	'uuid': 'ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f'
},
'Mountpoint': '/data/volumes/6d71d6db6027de2ed1816914abc1b07e76e716c5a257be3ca61222d2e2a37f3b/_data',
'Name': '6d71d6db6027de2ed1816914abc1b07e76e716c5a257be3ca61222d2e2a37f3b',
'Options': None,
'Scope': 'local'
}, {
'CreatedAt': '2022-06-14T08:26:48Z',
'Driver': 'local',
'Labels': {
	'source': 'dy-sidecar_ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f_home_jovyan_work_inputs',
	'swarm_stack_name': 'production-simcore',
	'uuid': 'ec49c123-a30f-41c5-95ef-c049baea2d8f'
},
'Mountpoint': '/data/volumes/0fa11cfe4c671feb5b8c94d8dde495bfb9c4ca53811e4b047c2e150ad7b55d72/_data',
'Name': '0fa11cfe4c671feb5b8c94d8dde495bfb9c4ca53811e4b047c2e150ad7b55d72',
'Options': None,
'Scope': 'local'
}]
""]
}
```

# Fix Proposal

To avoid this common situation I propose creating a `service_session_id` whenever a service is started. 
This `service_session_id` will be then added to the volume labels to uniquely identify the volume.
This will address the issue with dy-sidecar not being able to correctly identify volumes which were just created.


**NOTE**: also remove following code since it has no effect when multiple nodes are part of a swarm, since volumes are only removed form the node where the docker engine runs

https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/master/services/director-v2/src/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/dynamic_sidecar/scheduler/events.py#L581-L628

To implement proper volume removal, a service running on each node, accepting requests for volume removal would be required.

title: When dynamic service fails badly, ALL studies are blocked

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
## Long story short

when a dynamic service is failed but the container somehow is not removed, this blocks the user from opening any studies

## Actual behaviour

no studies of this user can be opened anymore

## Steps to reproduce

A service failed in a study and after the study was closed, the container of the failed service was not removed (in this case it was a dsistudio-app, which is half of a novnc service)
When the user who owns that study tries to open ANY other study (or create a new one), the entry is created in the database, but director-v2 complains:
```
    return [
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/director_v0.py", line 161, in <listcomp>
    RunningDynamicServiceDetails(**x)
  File "pydantic/main.py", line 331, in pydantic.main.BaseModel.__init__
pydantic.error_wrappers.ValidationError: 1 validation error for RunningDynamicServiceDetails
service_port
  none is not an allowed value (type=type_error.none.not_allowed)
  ```
The frontend gets error:
```
{"error": {"status": 400, "errors": [{"code": "type_error.uuid", "message": "value is not a valid uuid", "resource": "/v0/projects/${STUDY_UUID}:open", "field": "project_id"}]}}
```
for EVERY study the user owns.

body:
In dalco staging found the following error:

```log
ERROR:simcore_service_director_v2.modules.comp_scheduler.base_scheduler:Project 43b58207-6520-43bf-a890-0727643c0c03: task=CompTaskAtDB(project_id=UUID('43b58207-6520-43bf-a890-0727643c0c03'), node_id=UUID('0b569007-f8e6-5904-898a-ac63eb731efa'), job_id='367ea609-7360-4f3e-a8e0-46b61ede6ce2', node_schema=NodeSchema(inputs={'input_1': ServiceInput(display_order=1.0, label='Input data', description='Any code, requirements or data file', property_type='data:*/*', content_schema=None, file_to_key_map=None, unit=None, default_value=None, widget=None)}, outputs={'output_1': _ServiceOutputOverride(display_order=1.0, label='Output data', description='All data produced by the script is zipped as output_data.zip', property_type='data:*/*', content_schema=None, file_to_key_map={'output_data.zip': 'output_1'}, unit=None, widget=None)}), inputs={'input_1': SimCoreFileLink(store='0', path='api/5f45da4b-970b-3606-b4fe-097a985563c2/LFCreation.zip', label='LFCreation.zip', e_tag='ea0620ad624067c63ee13ec4cd8eaffb', dataset=None), 'NCPU': 2.0}, outputs={}, run_hash=None, image=Image(name='simcore/services/comp/s4l-python-runner', tag='1.0.9', requires_gpu=False, requires_mpi=False, node_requirements=NodeRequirements(cpu=1.0, gpu=0, ram=134217728, mpi=0), command=['run']), submit=datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 3, 14, 29, 8, 579659), start=datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 3, 14, 46, 39, 208334), end=datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 3, 14, 46, 37, 120578), state=<RunningState.STARTED: 'STARTED'>, task_id=961547, internal_id=1, node_class=<NodeClass.COMPUTATIONAL: 'COMPUTATIONAL'>, errors=None) has backend_state=<RunningState.UNKNOWN: 'UNKNOWN'>. The task disappeared from the dask-scheduler, aborting the computational pipeline!
ERROR:simcore_service_director_v2.modules.comp_scheduler.background_task:Unexpected error in computational scheduler task, restarting scheduler now...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/comp_scheduler/background_task.py", line 21, in scheduler_task
    await scheduler.schedule_all_pipelines()
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/comp_scheduler/base_scheduler.py", line 118, in schedule_all_pipelines
    await asyncio.gather(
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/comp_scheduler/base_scheduler.py", line 312, in _schedule_pipeline
    await self._update_states_from_comp_backend(
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/comp_scheduler/base_scheduler.py", line 264, in _update_states_from_comp_backend
    await self._process_completed_tasks(user_id, cluster_id, tasks_completed)
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/comp_scheduler/dask_scheduler.py", line 131, in _process_completed_tasks
    await asyncio.gather(
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/modules/comp_scheduler/dask_scheduler.py", line 157, in _process_task_result
    ) = parse_dask_job_id(task.job_id)
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/simcore_service_director_v2/utils/dask.py", line 92, in parse_dask_job_id
    parts[1],
IndexError: list index out of range
```

This is due to backwards incompatibility of the format in ``job_id`` column in ``comp_task`` table. I found at least three version of this ``job_id`` and created this test setup in case you want to use it

```python
import pytest

@pytest.mark.parametrize(
    "comp_task_row",
    [
        # v1
        {
            "task_id": "919171",
            "project_id": "32130480-fe9a-11eb-92d3-02420a0b00bd",
            "node_id": "b022b49c-8c42-4014-9f47-9c5c3f687fea",
            "job_id": "5f46614f-156a-48dc-b3a1-d18ea081552e",
        },
        # v2
        {
            "task_id": "1460960",
            "project_id": "ac064134-4306-11ec-a206-02420a0b2350",
            "node_id": "e0788777-a386-4f9b-bbc3-a2fb7c3cdfcc",
            "job_id": "simcore/services/comp/osparc-python-runner-tensorflow_1.0.4__projectid_ac064134-4306-11ec-a206-02420a0b2350__nodeid_e0788777-a386-4f9b-bbc3-a2fb7c3cdfcc__098b8416-44f3-4146-8b5c-be4361b896a1",
        },
        # v3
        {
            "task_id": "1801993",
            "project_id": "febe4179-fa0b-410f-a8e4-20e71c6e37c2",
            "node_id": "7a00525c-f213-5271-8e2d-a20f944f8dd6",
            "job_id": "simcore/services/comp/latex-compile:1.3.0:userid_21790:projectid_febe4179-fa0b-410f-a8e4-20e71c6e37c2:nodeid_7a00525c-f213-5271-8e2d-a20f944f8dd6:uuid_c3cdf06c-26e3-4ae0-b20f-21e2abd30017",
        },
    ],
)
def test_backwards_compatibility_parse_dask_job_id(
    comp_task_row: dict[str, str]
):
     _,_,project_id, node_id, _ = parse_dask_job_id(comp_task_row["job_id"])
     assert project_id == comp_task_row["project_id"]
     assert node_id == comp_task_row["node_id"]

```

Some thoughts about possible solutions

- Drop: Can remove these lines from table. The only risk is that the task really did not run and gets completely lost
- Force upgrade: Have a script that upgrades database old format into the latest format
- Lazy upgrade: Have an automatic conversion upon read of a row or keep some sort of backwards compatibility

And regarding this formatting/parsing of ``job_id``. Would it suffice to serialize/deserialize in a json string from a pydantic model. I had the same scenario with automatic tagging and I see little advantage having other sort of string serialization format.

title: Maintenance: old services are using outdated Docker REST API, or wrong

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Most of 3rd party services that define a resource reservation do it by setting a label such as:
```python
{"Resources" {"Reservations":{"NanoCPUs":123}}}
```

This is wrong and should be:
```python
{"Resources" {"Reservation":{"NanoCPUs":123}}}
```
see [https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.41/#operation/ServiceCreate](https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.41/#operation/ServiceCreate)


Nevertheless we should also keep backward compatibility.

For info @pcrespov , @GitHK , @mguidon , @odeimaiz

title: On Windows Deployments using Docker Desktop, comp. jobs cannot be run

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dask-service
labels.description: Any of the dask services: dask-scheduler/sidecar or worker

body:
## Long story short

On Windows Dpeloyments using Docker Desktop, comp. jobs cannot be run.

This is due to the input-files not being copied into the computational service's container. This again is caused by the `computational_shared_services` named volume being accessed via its bind-path, which on wsl2 is `/var/lib/docker/.......`. However, it turns out that when Docker Desktop with the wsl2 backend is used, the path is actually fake. In reality, the data of named volumes is stored in a second wsl2 distro (see https://www.docker.com/blog/new-docker-desktop-wsl2-backend/ ).

So, as Docker Developers seem to not guarantee that named volumes can be accessed via their path in all environments, we should only access named docker volumes via their name, and not their possibly not accessible bind mount path.

The solution proposed by @sanderegg is to deprecate the `shared_computational_data` volume and use only bind mounts, which seems to fix the issue.

## Expected behaviour

Comp. Services work

## Actual behaviour

Comp. Services fail

## Steps to reproduce

- Checkout `osparc-local` branch of osparc-ops-repository.
- Run `make up-local`
- Run `cd scripts/provisionDatabase && make up`
- Create user "test@example.org"
- Start sleeper
- Watch sleeper fail

## Your environment

oSparc Full-Ops Local on WSL2 with Docker Desktop

This error does not come periodically, but can be triggered by visiting a portal link specifically, for example using the puppeteer in osparc-simcore via `node CC_Rabbit.js https://osparc.io/study/ 47d0b766-af53-11e9-a62b-02420aff7e72 300000 --demo`. Check graylog for more details with this query: `container_name:/.*catalog.*/ AND "KeyError: ('simcore/services/"`

The affected services in the `KeyError` vary, I saw at least iSolve 2.1.0, iSolve 2.0.81 and ascent-runner 1.1.0.

If the catalog is restarted, puppeteer links work for a while (some minutes), and then the mentioned issues with associated error patterns surface again. This behavior of "briefly working after the restart" is reproducible.

This error also happens on osparc-master for portal-links, but portal links work subjectively felt "more often" on master than on osparc.io

A brief investigation with @pcrespov hint at this being a caching related issue.

Currently, portal links on osparc.io are broken because of this issue.

Portal links work

## Actual behaviour

Portal links dont work

This error should be handled more gracefully without blocking the director-v2, for example by changing the state of the task to FAILED.

Director-v2 is slowed and overwhelmed

UNCLEAR

title: ✨♻️  Differentiate between TLS and STARTTLS in web-mailserver  (⚠️ devops)

labels.name: t:enhancement
labels.description: Improvement or request on an existing feature

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: t:maintenance
labels.description: Some planned maintenance work

labels.name: security
labels.description: Pull requests that address a security vulnerability

body:
<!-- Common title prefixes/annotations:
PREFIX:

  WIP: work in progress
  🐛    Fix a bug.
  ✨    Introduce new features.
  ♻️     Refactor code.
  🚑️    Critical hotfix.
  ⚗️     Perform experiments.
  ⬆️    Upgrade dependencies.
  📝    Add or update documentation.
  🗑️    Deprecate code that needs to be cleaned up.
  ⚰️     Remove dead code.
  🔥    Remove code or files.
  🔨    Add or update development scripts.

or from https://gitmoji.dev/ and https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/blob/master/src/data/gitmojis.json

SUFFIX:
 (⚠️ devops)  changes in devops configuration required before deploying

-->

## What do these changes do?

This enables the mail-sending functionality of the webserver to handle `STARTTLS` and `TLS`. Before, only `STARTTLS` was possible. Furthermore, there were naming ambigouitites , as the env-vars referred to `TLS`, which is different from `STARTTLS`

Bonus:
- Adds settings-test ensuring that not both `STARTTLS` and `TLS` are simultaneously requested
- Updates black-linter in precommit-hook, which would crash on my dev-PC in the old version



**_⚠️ devops_**:
Deprecates the Env-Var:
`SMTP_TLS_ENABLED`
Introduces the Env-Var:
`SMTP_PROTOCOL`
which can have the values
- `UNENCRYPTED`
- `TLS`
- `STARTTLS`


## Related issue/s

- https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/issues/2944
- https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/issues/2882


## How to test

I did a dry-run test, but since we do not fully emulate an external mail-server in our tests this will have to be properly checked in master. The dry-run test involved running the `send_mail(app: web.Application, msg: MIMEText)` function vanilla in python, outside oSparc.


## Checklist



- [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
- [x] Runs in the swarm
- [x] Documentation reflects the changes

body:
## Long story short
I tried to share a service (owned by me) on master. Selecting a group gives a weird GUI problem and doesn't actually share the service. In fact, the service itself disappears until another refresh. 

## Expected behaviour
I am able to share the study and receive a confirmation message that the service has been shared (as before).

title: Entries in file_meta_data table not deleted when project is deleted

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:database
labels.description: associated to postgres service and postgres-database package

body:
## Long story short

If a project is deleted, the corresponding entries of uploaded files in `file_meta_data` are not deleted. The files in S3 are not deleted. This thus puts the database into an unclean state.

## Expected behaviour

If a project is deleted, associated S3 files and their entries in `file_meta_data` are deleted.

## Actual behaviour

Entries in `file_meta_data` might not be deleted.

## Steps to reproduce

On osparc-master:
- Create a new project
- Add a file-picker, upload file
- Exit to dashboard
- Delete the project
- Check `file_meta_data` table using adminer, the entry to the uploaded file is still present

## Your environment

osparc-master deployment

title: release Github workflow process fail when there are branches left in upstream

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
```console
- name: set target variable
        run: |
          target=$(git name-rev --refs="refs/remotes/origin/*" --name-only ${GITHUB_SHA})
          echo "TARGET=${target}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
```
if there are branches left over from the dependabot, then this call fails to retrieve the branch name.

It should be replaced by this:
```console
- name: find branch name
        shell: bash
        run: echo "BRANCH_NAME=$(echo ${GITHUB_REF#refs/heads/} | tr / -)" >> $GITHUB_ENV
```
to be tested of course!

title: Jupyterlab in AWS production doesn't shout down when there is an error in saving a study

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
## Long story short

Jupyterlab service not shutting down properly


## Steps to reproduce
Kudos to @KZzizzle for finding out what was going on. This is what happened:

1. A jupyterlab math on aws has >5gb data
2. Going to the dashboard triggers the error uploading to AWS
3. The container stays up even when back in the dashboard and the "closing lock" disappears
4. Going back in the study re-accesses the same live container

## Expected behavior
As an user who doesn't know what's going on I'd like.
1. A warning telling me that I won't be able to save the study because of the file limit (at least until this is solved)
2. See an error when I go back to the dashboard. What I saw was just the lock (for a long time).

## Your environment
osparc.io, The study name contains "Analyse", study id should be dedb95fa-9ec8-11ec-94c5-02420a0b024d

title: Dynamic service (jupyter smash) keeps uploading large files to S3 and bricks dalco

labels.name: a:infra+ops
labels.description: maintenance of infrastructure or operations (discussed in retro)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dynamic-sidecar
labels.description: dynamic-sidecar service

body:
On 09Feb2022, there was data loss on dalco-production. Investigation led to show that the minio-cluster of dalco was in a very bad state (continuous inter-node communication, file-healing, some storage nodes left the swam, high network activity, long disk i/o times).

This was triggered by an upload of almost 1Tb of files in total, starting 4pm. The user stopped working on the study at approx 6pm, when she left the office and left oSparc tabs open.
This file upload was originating from a sim4life jupyter smash dynamic service in Melanie's study, who continuously uploaded the same file (output_1.zip), over and over. The file has 14Gb for each version. Minio/S3 recorded each of these uploads in its versioning system. I checked versions v35, v93 and v97 individually. 

To find: In minio mc tool with alias `dalco` properly set, run `mc ls dalco/production-simcore/38a2e328-4c5c-11ec-854c-02420a0b01d2 --versions -r | sort`.

Their content and md5sum is identical. The uploads likely stopped when minio was in such a bad state that two out of 4 nodes went down simulateously, quorum was lost, and the storage cluster was unreachable for some time. IO activity on minio was happening until midnight (see grafana), the last version of the file was noted in minio as modified at `[2022-02-08 22:24:46 UTC]`.


Possible follow-ups:
- Investigate why the notebook decided to upload output_1.zip over and over again.
- Don't reupload a file version if its hash is identical to a previously stored version
- Handle only smaller files on oSparc.

Caution:
- We dont have many Terrabytes on dalco, so if this happenes again a few times, our storage will be full.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/153259720-485d3b95-b586-4e15-ba29-4fca28a41925.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/153259753-d043ecb9-f6b3-4139-b9e3-14058060ed7e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/153259829-9aa52d2a-43d5-4b21-8a8f-11e622a58db4.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/153259938-e8749cf5-7123-4104-a6e9-2a297efba3e3.png)

title: 🐛 re: Incident. Webserver: Load and error when exporting / duplicating study

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

body:
This is a write-up of the indicdent investigation. Feel free to modify and/or close this issue if it is a duplicate etc.

========================



On the night from 07Feb to 08Feb on aws-prod, a `:duplicate` request was received on that lead to an short outage of osparc. The request was redirected to the webserver, who proceeded to perform many IO disk operations and achieved 100% CPU load for some minutes:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8209087/153005721-48461631-610b-4641-bbb8-5e2961a9fd48.png)
(sorry for the mouse-pointer in the screenshot, the CPU spike is hidden behind it...)

Finally, the request was answered after 480seconds with a 500 by the webserver, as an Exception occured.

The current line of thinking is:
- the websever is using a lot of CPU to zip stuff
- A `asyncio.exceptions.CancelledError` occured in `_run_http_download`, so likely the download timed out.

```

Responding with status 500","[0;31mERROR[0m: servicelib.aiohttp.monitoring:middleware_handler(216) - Unexpected server error ""<class 'aiohttp.web_exceptions.HTTPInternalServerError'>"" from access: 10.0.97.40 ""POST /v0/projects/0f9b7548-3b1e-11ec-917d-02420a0b3377:duplicate"" done in 479.60 secs. Responding with status 500
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/parfive/downloader.py"", line 295, in run_download
    done.update(await self._run_http_download(main_pb, timeouts))
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/parfive/downloader.py"", line 429, in _run_http_download
    done, _ = await asyncio.wait(futures)
  File ""/usr/local/lib/python3.8/asyncio/tasks.py"", line 426, in wait
    return await _wait(fs, timeout, return_when, loop)
  File ""/usr/local/lib/python3.8/asyncio/tasks.py"", line 534, in _wait

asyncio.exceptions.CancelledError

title: In director-v0: Better error handling when save-data request to dynamic services fails.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director
labels.description: issue related with the director service

body:
If a study with dynamic services (we are primarily concerned with jupyter notebooks here) is closed, the director-v0 instructs the dynamic service to shut down gracefully. This triggers a hook in the jupyter-notebook that saves the data to S3.

If this request, from the director-v0 to the jupyter, fails for some reason (timeout or non-200 return code), the following happens:
- The director-v0 logs `service %s could not be contacted, state not saved` (`producer.py` lines 1036 and further)
- The service is removed, i.e. the container is stopped and removed from the machine

This implies definite data-loss if the REST POST request in `producer.py` line 1041 fails.

More graceful error handling may include:
- Trying again a few times to trigger the POST request
- Keep the container (just stop it) if the save-request falls through. Then, manual data recovery (logging into the container and zipping the data) would be possible. Then however, undeleted containers would bloat the machine in the long run. 


On Friday, some user data was impacted by this.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
@newton1985 has a study that starts >10 dynamic services. 

On opening all the iframes are opened right away, and the respective connections are created right away, overloading the backend AND the frontend.

Possible solutions:
- only open the service iframe when the service is first opened, this will make opening a project much more reactive
- check whether the number of requests made in parallel is not too high to continue handling normal osparc operations

title: services with uvicorn do not auto reload in development mode

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
## How to reproduce it

- deploy in dev mode the stack
```cmd
make build-devel
make up-devel
```
- open portainer and wait (a good time) until any uvicorn-based service is running (e.g. director-v2)
- change a file in the source code of the service 
- the server should auto restart but it does not


## What I have tried so far
 
- A similar behavior was detected when ``uvicorn >0.14`` released. Recent [update](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/commit/67a91d5261075fbe1a14c9bd6829faf43022bf88#diff-86d5fe588ff2fc7dccb1f4cdd8019d4473146536e88d7a9ede946ea962a91acbL39) *might* explain why it stopped working
- I have tested running a simple fastapi app with ``uvicorn 0.17.0.post1 with CPython 3.8.10 on Linux`` and works
```
$ uvicorn simple_app:app --host 0.0.0.0 --reload --reload-dir .
INFO:     Will watch for changes in these directories: ['/devel/src']
INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://0.0.0.0:8000 (Press CTRL+C to quit)
INFO:     Started reloader process [40] using statreload.  <------------------------- STARTED WATCHER
INFO:     Started server process [42]
INFO:     Waiting for application startup.
INFO:     Application startup complete.
WARNING:  StatReload detected file change in 'simple_app/__init__.py'. Reloading... <------------------------- I CHANGED FILE
INFO:     Shutting down
INFO:     Waiting for application shutdown.
INFO:     Application shutdown complete.
INFO:     Finished server process [42]
```

This indicates that the problem might be in our boot scripts (``boot.sh``) or the fact that our volumes are mounted (i recall an issue in windows docker where watchdogs could not detect modifications on mounted volumes). I would suggest those as the lines to investigate

In addition, to this bug, we should take advantage of the new CLI options ``--reload-include`` and ``--reload-exclude`` options of uvicorn for [development](https://www.uvicorn.org/settings/#development)

title: webserver shows ```write is none``` when restarted while connecting to RabbitMQ

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Observed today reproducibly.

When the webserver is restarted it fails connecting to rabbitMQ showing the following error log:
[https://app.zenhub.com/files/118596920/84f1586f-4157-42af-881e-0fcd853d8fef/download](https://app.zenhub.com/files/118596920/84f1586f-4157-42af-881e-0fcd853d8fef/download)

After some research on aio_pika, it seems the library is affected by the problem mentioned [here](https://github.com/mosquito/aio-pika/issues/288). This fix might never happen from the comments there.

We shall try to reconnect manually.

Elsewise maybe using directly pika with the asyncio binding would be another more stable option [reference](https://github.com/pika/pika). The pika library seems now to be compatible with asyncio.

title: Garbage collector seems to have an impact on webserver responsiveness

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
As discovered today with DK, it seems the interval of the garbage collector has an influence on the fact that the webserver becomes periodically unable to answer the healthcheck within 1 second.

DK used a script to bombard the webserver with healtcheck using curl from the simcore_traefik node, showing that there is a periodic request that returns in more than 1 second. (reference [here](https://ops.tips/gists/measuring-http-response-times-curl/))

By changing the ```WEBSERVER_GARBAGE_COLLECTION_INTERVAL_SECONDS``` variable from 30 seconds to 300 made the error completely disappear.
Now it is set to 90seconds.

But it seems that whatever the garbage collector is doing, that it completely prevents the webserver from doing its work correctly.
