title: 🐛 Fixes: python runner fails raising FileNotFoundError

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: changelog:🐛bugfix
labels.description: Needed for automatic changelog generation

body:
## What do these changes do?

Fixes running python-runner error due to missing folder when pulling inputs to the service. 

This bug is also found in production. Hotfix required.

### Steps
1. create a ``main.py`` with
```python
print("hello world")
```
2. connect to a python runner and run as
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32402063/146242536-5bae881c-d50d-4b47-bc3a-722dc8defd3a.png)

This run would fail with the following log
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32402063/146243009-e4a0a0f1-ad09-4aab-9ed3-ee6b471abdb2.png)

since the routine ``pull_file_from_remote`` would raise ``FileNotFoundError`` because the folders for the destination path do not exist.

The design guarantees (by ``TaskSharedVolumes.__post_init__``) that the input/outputs and logs folders exist (although not that they are empty!). The problem is that  ``destination_path = task_volumes.inputs_folder / something_else`` and `something_else`` path might have some extra sub-folders.

This PR provides a temporary fix but IMO is not fully satisfactory since ``destination_path``
- upon creation we ignore if the folder already exists and contains previous results (by setting ``exists_ok=True``)
- ~~does not define a clear lifetime: i.e. a clean creation/deletion context~~ -> ``TaskSharedVolumes`` provides a context manager but does not guarantee ``cleanup``.


## Related issue/s



## How to test

- tests input/output files with subfolders
```command
cd services/dask-sidecar
make install-dev
pytest --pdb -vv tests/unit/test_tasks.py
```

title: Creating a study from a template or Publishing as Template should not be visible when it fails

labels.name: t:enhancement
labels.description: Improvement or request on an existing feature

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Users are starting to misuse the webserver:
- they have a big/huge study  or template in terms of data
- using Publish as template or Create from template entrypoint actually first creates a new entry in the database and then copies the data
- when the copying fails, the study is still in the database


-> The entry should be removed from the database in case of:
- timeout of the webbrowser
- error while copying

To still allow for copying the project skeleton a new entrypoint shall be added that EXPLICITELY tells the webserver to only copy the skeleton. To this end the webserver shall remove from the workbench all the:
- outputs
- progress
- run_hash

and append (⚠️ devops) if changes in devops configuration required before deploying
-->

## What do these changes do?

An unhandled exception is causing the ``director`` service to respond with 500 every time is requested to list running services services.

The exception displayed ``ValueError: unconverted data remains:  Z`` and was raised while parsing an invalid string into a ``datetime``.

A new utils with a more robust ``parse_as_datetime`` routine was implemented. In case of an invalid string, the function will return a default provided in the arguments. 

## Related issue/s

None.

## How to test

NOTE: needs python 3.6 in place (e.g. use ``pyenv local`` )
NOTE: avoid using ``make install-dev``, since it was not adapted properly since this service will be soon removed
```cmd
make devenv
cd services/director
pip install -e .
pytest tests/unit/test_utils.py
```

title: SystemError  11, Resource temporarily unavailable in Dask sidecar

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:dask-service
labels.description: Any of the dask services: dask-scheduler/sidecar or worker

body:
```python
ERROR:servicelib.utils:Error occured while running task!","ERROR:servicelib.utils:Error occured while running task!
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/servicelib/utils.py"", line 72, in log_exception_callback
    fut.result()
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/servicelib/logging_utils.py"", line 137, in log_decorator_wrapper
    value = await func(*args, **kwargs)
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/simcore_service_sidecar/log_parser.py"", line 73, in monitor_logs_task
    await _monitor_docker_container(
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/servicelib/logging_utils.py"", line 137, in log_decorator_wrapper
    value = await func(*args, **kwargs)
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/simcore_service_sidecar/log_parser.py"", line 94, in _monitor_docker_container
    async with AIOFile(str(log_file), ""w+"") as afp:
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/aiofile/aio.py"", line 113, in __init__
    self.__context = context or get_default_context()
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/aiofile/aio.py"", line 251, in get_default_context
    return create_context()
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/aiofile/aio.py"", line 238, in create_context
    context = caio.AsyncioContext(max_requests, loop=loop)
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/caio/asyncio_base.py"", line 23, in __init__
    self.context = self._create_context(
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/caio/linux_aio_asyncio.py"", line 10, in _create_context
    context = super()._create_context(max_requests)
  File ""/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/caio/asyncio_base.py"", line 62, in _create_context
    return self.CONTEXT_CLASS(max_requests=max_requests, **kwargs)
SystemError: (11, 'Resource temporarily unavailable')
```

After doing some digging on stackoverflow it seems the issue is linked to creating too many threads. Please see [this post and accepted answer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13340893/oserror-errno-11-resource-temporarily-unavailable-what-causes-this).
In fact `AIOFile` in [`loop.run_in_executor`](https://github.com/mosquito/aiofile/blob/5b5edf88f57cc5b469e6d43bf0ecd9c5a3c1acad/aiofile/aio.py#L123) uses the default threadpool. In python 3.8  the [max_workers argument](https://docs.python.org/3/library/concurrent.futures.html#concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor) is raised significantly form previous implementations. At this point I guess each sidecar and dask-sidecar will allocate 36 threads in the system.

As a fix: I'd suggest to update `aiofile` to the latest version where the [`_run_in_thread`](https://github.com/mosquito/aiofile/blob/4d2c980d6f78dafadd058ba7d95f90f85b91416a/aiofile/aio.py#L147) will use a custom ThreadPoolExecutor. In this case I would only use 1 thread.

Since on DALCO we are running the old (celery) implementation with multiple sidecars for production and 1 dask-sidecar for staging it ends up with 5 * 36 = 180 threads in total.
This might bring us closer to the limits and cause the "Resource temporarily unavailable" error.

I'd also inspect the code for calls to `loop.run_in_executor ` to try and limit threads if possible.

title: Share Guided Mode Settings in Template

labels.name: t:enhancement
labels.description: Improvement or request on an existing feature

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
**USER STORY:**

Publishing a study as a template does not result in guided mode settings being saved in the template. When a copy of that template is created, all "slides" are set by default to invisible so there is nothing when Guided Mode is activated 

**DEFINITION OF DONE:**

0. Template study stores Guided Mode settings
1. Creating a study from a template will copy over the Guided mode settings

Note: this behavior does not happen when a study instance is shared - only for templates

title: Clicking on share link of a TEMPLATE study results in ghost study

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
**USER STORY:**

For templates, you are allowed to manage share options and also obtain a share link to that template. When that link is used, it generates a "ghost" study with services that don't start. In addition, logging out of the account and logging back in makes this "ghost study" disappear see animation below

Expected behavior would be:
* clicking a template share link would create that study (if you have access rights to the template)
* If the user does not have access to study, error message about not having access to the template
* Study created is like any other created from a template with working services and persistence through logging in/logout
Alternatively:
Disable share link for templates for time being until someone asks for this feature 

![ghost](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28002886/135235496-378b5bbd-b554-4301-abb2-a5461fcf052f.gif)

## What do these changes do?


Analyzed logs of ``webserver``, ``storage`` and ``datcoreadapter`` services.  Found and fix the folling issues:

#### webserver.storage_api call times out [``webserver``]
- Increases *total timeout* from **20 secs to 5 mins** so it takes time to copy

  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/aiohttp/web_app.py", line 499, in _handle

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'resp' referenced before assignment

```

#### 🐛  Uncaught timeout exception [``storage``, ``datcore_adapter``]

title: Bug: Auto Upgrade Policy of services. Issue with multiple digits versions

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:catalog
labels.description: catalog service

body:
Auto Upgrade Policy sorts previous releases wrongly.  Sorting is done lexicographical instead of numerical. See for instances here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33161876/131542830-cfe90b24-bd3f-45ba-9744-7084225ca0c5.png)
1.6.11 inherits the user rights from 1.6.9 instead of 1.6.10

title: MPI tutorial fails in dask-sidecar because sidecar_mode is always set to CPU

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: e2e
labels.description: Bugs found by or related to the end-2-end testing

body:
- Running MPI tutorial runs through but in reality it runs in CPU mode. NOTICE that in the envvar in the following screenshot
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5caef818ecad11531cc41364/f8d7999b-76e5-4226-91f3-2fc471591a50)

the e2e tutorial shows a failure because it looks for ``Running MPI version 3.1 on 2 processes`` in the log

The solution is to set the ``sidecar_mode`` in ``simcore_service_director_v2.modules.dask_client... comp_sidecar_fct``

This PR makes the invalidate password and confirmationPassword more user friendly.

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Explain REVIEWERS what is this PR about -->

If a validation error would occur inside a class a property of a class derived from `BaseCustomSettings` attached to a class inheriting from `BaseCustomSettings`, the error would get swallowed up. Debugging was a nightmare.

What will this bring:
- removes error suppression
- clear debug message on validation errors with environment dumped for easier debugging
- fixes issues with storage
- adds default `DYNAMIC_SIDECAR_IMAGE` to `.env-devel` + minor enhancement

title: 🐛 fixing randomly failing [sys] deploy simcore

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: t:maintenance
labels.description: Some planned maintenance work

body:
<!-- Common title prefixes/annotations:

WIP: work in progress

Consider prefix your PR message with an emoticon
  🐛 bugfix
  ✨ new feature
  ♻️ refactoring
  💄 updates UI or 🚸 UX/usability
  🚑️ hotfix
  ⚗️ experimental
  ⬆️ upgrades dependencies
  📝 documentation
or from https://gitmoji.dev/

and append (⚠️ devops) if changes in devops configuration required before deploying
-->

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Explain REVIEWERS what is this PR about -->

### Issue 1

When the `[sys] deploy simcore` runs, it starts the CI and checks that all the docker services are started.
Because docker-swarm has no way to tell if the application is ready, `wait-for` is used to ensure all application components are booted before starting other components.
Most importantly PostgresSQL is required to be running and all migrations must be applied.

Changes:
- `migration` service will start an http server once it's ready
- the following services will wait for `migration` to be ready before continuing to boot:
    - director-v2
    - director-v0
    - webserver
    - api-server
    - catalog
    - sidecar
    - storage
- `wait-for` script was used and added to the repo; a test to ensure its present was also added

### Issue 2

The `test_core_service_running` never took into consideration task slots. Each replica of a service is assigned a task slot. Multiple tasks may be present in the tasks list for each slot.
Addressing this issue fixed the randomly failing CI issues 🎉 

**Trivia:** this PR will help mainly unlucky developers, some of us could have lived without it. I personally think that restarting the CI 18 times is not ideal.

## Related issue/s

<!-- Enumerate REVIEWERS other issues

e.g.

- #26 : node_ports should have retry policies when upload/download fails  (FIXED)
- ITISFoundation/osparc-issues#304: (Part 2) Prep2Go: creating features to support complex S4L scripts (IMPLEMENTED)

-->

title: director2 scheduler reports ``CelerySchedulerError``

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
```
simcore_service_director_v2.core.errors.CelerySchedulerError: The pipeline of project 89bcc03e-db92-11eb-8a47-02420a0b0072 does not contain an adjacency list! Please check.
```
and according to the notes in the code, this error should never happen.

See [log](https://monitoring.osparc.speag.com/graylog/messages/graylog_5/fc366871-def5-11eb-bec7-0242ac12000b) for more details

I wonder if we need some cleaning task to remove invalid entries from db

title: 🐛addresses blocking Thread/Process pool executors when shutting down

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

labels.name: a:services-library
labels.description: issues on packages/service-libs

labels.name: a:catalog
labels.description: catalog service

body:
<!-- Common title prefixes/annotations:

WIP: work in progress

Consider prefix your PR message with an emoticon
  🐛 bugfix
  ✨ new feature
  🔨 refactoring
  🏗️ maintenance
  📚 documentation

and append (⚠️ devops) if changes in devops configuration required before deploying

  SEE https://github.com/dannyfritz/commit-message-emoji
  SEE https://emojipedia.org
-->

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Explain REVIEWERS what is this PR about -->

While debugging the below error, it was observed that when closing a `ThreadPoolExecutor` or a `ProcessPoolExecutor`, both will wait for threads/processes before closing. 

```python
  _     ._   __/__   _ _  _  _ _/_   Recorded: 03:31:46  Samples:  1,
 /_//_/// /_\ / //_// / //_'/ //     Duration: 5.901     CPU time: 5.870,
/   _/                      v3.4.2,
,
Program: /home/scu/.venv/bin/simcore-service-webserver --config server-docker-prod.yaml,
,
5.898 instrumented  servicelib/monitor_slow_callbacks.py:23,
└─ 5.898 instrumented  aiodebug/log_slow_callbacks.py:16,
   └─ 5.898 _run  asyncio/events.py:143,
      └─ 5.898 metrics_handler  simcore_service_webserver/diagnostics_monitoring.py:32,
         └─ 5.898 __exit__  concurrent/futures/_base.py:610,
            └─ 5.898 shutdown  concurrent/futures/thread.py:146,
               └─ 5.898 join  threading.py:1024,
                  └─ 5.898 _wait_for_tstate_lock  threading.py:1062,
                     └─ 5.898 lock.acquire  ../../<built-in>:0,
```

Where possible pools where created and reused, in all other cases a non blocking shutdown was used via contextmanger.

## Related issue/s

There is an [issue with cypython](https://bugs.python.org/issue34073) where a ProcessPoolExecutor which raises an error on `shutdown(wait=False)`. Will use a shard ProcessPoolExecutor where it was requested crated per request.
<!-- Enumerate REVIEWERS other issues

e.g.

- #26 : node_ports should have retry policies when upload/download fails  (FIXED)
- ITISFoundation/osparc-issues#304: (Part 2) Prep2Go: creating features to support complex S4L scripts (IMPLEMENTED)

-->

title: archiving files with surrogateescape characters

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:services-library
labels.description: issues on packages/service-libs

body:
In python surrogateescape cannot be printed, meaning they cannot be transformed to any character https://stackoverflow.com/a/27367173/2855718
This cause issues with the `archiving_utils.py` module shared by dynamic services.

Because files are added one by one using the filename in the archive via zip-file
The below crash happens in such a situation

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
UnicodeEncodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't encode character '\udce6' in position 7: surrogates not allowed
return self.filename.encode('ascii'), self.flag_bits
Could write files to archive, please check logs
return self.filename.encode('utf-8'), self.flag_bits | 0x800
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/zipfile.py", line 452, in _encodeFilenameFlags
self.fp.write(zinfo.FileHeader(zip64))
zip_file_handler.write(file_to_add, file_name_in_archive)
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/zipfile.py", line 454, in _encodeFilenameFlags
with open(filename, "rb") as src, self.open(zinfo, 'w') as dest:
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/servicelib/archiving_utils.py", line 128, in _serial_add_to_archive
filename, flag_bits = self._encodeFilenameFlags()
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/zipfile.py", line 1603, in _open_to_write
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 7-8: ordinal not in range(128)
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/zipfile.py", line 1763, in write
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/zipfile.py", line 442, in FileHeader
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/zipfile.py", line 1506, in open
return self._open_to_write(zinfo, force_zip64=force_zip64)
ValueError: There was an error while archiving
File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/jupyter_commons/handlers/state.py", line 53, in post
Traceback (most recent call last):
raise ValueError("There was an error while archiving")
```

Current implementation see line

https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/dc4c691d2aaac558b19c54441ce2999df7717f2c/packages/service-library/src/servicelib/archiving_utils.py#L118-L130

The following issues suggests a way to fix (also used by other libraries) https://bugs.python.org/issue16310

body:
<!-- Common title prefixes/annotations:

  WIP:
  bugfix:
  🏗️ maintenance:

  (⚠️ devops)  = changes in devops config required before deploying
-->

## What do these changes do?

Fixes validation function for ``DiagnosticsSettings.max_task_delay``.  The variable failed when set using ``DIAGNOSTICS_MAX_TASK_DELAY`` environment variable. 

Now ``DIAGNOSTICS_MAX_TASK_DELAY=30`` secs


###  HOTFIX in production NEEDED after testing this fix in dev.
  - Probably cause for frequent restart of web-server in production
  - Currently production defaults ``DiagnosticsSettings.max_task_delay`` to 3 secs (after fixing #2288) which marks the webserver as un-healthy after a request takes more than 3 secs !!


## Related issue/s

- #2288
-  Frequent restart of web-server in production

body:
<!-- Common title prefixes/annotations:

  WIP:

-->

## What do these changes do?

Webserver cannot create a new project from template because storage cancels when copying template data in s3.



### Problem

Storage cancels the handler because the client (i.e. the web-server) times out.  Notice that the cancelation is while creating a client (see [here](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/master/services/storage/src/simcore_service_storage/dsm.py#L750)) 

Here we can see relevant part of the logs
- storage: **"POST /v0/simcore-s3/folders". Responding with status 500**

...

    await self._waiter
concurrent.futures._base.CancelledError <<<

```
- webserver: **"POST /v0/projects" done in 20.20 secs. Responding with status 500**
```
ERROR: simcore_service_webserver.diagnostics_monitoring:_middleware_handler(110) - Unexpected server error "<class 'aiohttp.web_exceptions.HTTPInternalServerError'>" from access: 10.3.95.28 "POST /v0/projects" done in 20.20 secs. Responding with status 500

  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/simcore_service_webserver/storage_api.py", line 44, in copy_data_folders_from_project
    ssl=False,
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/aiohttp/client.py", line 1012, in __aenter__
    self._resp = await self._coro
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/aiohttp/client.py", line 504, in _request
    await resp.start(conn)
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/aiohttp/client_reqrep.py", line 860, in start
    self._continue = None
  File "/home/scu/.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/aiohttp/helpers.py", line 596, in __exit__
    raise asyncio.TimeoutError from None
concurrent.futures._base.TimeoutError <<<<<<
```

### Hightlights

- refactors in storage ``create_folders_from_project`` -> ``deep_copy_project_simcore_s3``
   - aiobotocore session is created only once instead of upon every call
- upgrades requirements
- Creates ``tests/performance`` with [Locust](https://locust.io/) . 
   - Currently only enabled for manual testing of this issue
   - Tested with 100 parallel users for 569 requests w/o failures 

## Related issue/s

- address issue detected in the e2e
- Part of PR #2276 but submitted as a separate PR for convenience

## How to test

```command
cd osparc-simcore
make devenv
source .venv/bin/activate
cd services/storage
make install-dev
make tests
```

For manual testing, 
- build and deploy stack
```command
cd osparc-simcore
make build-x
make up-prod
```
- register, login, create a template project and share with everybody 
- set the UUID of this template project in ``test/performance/.env``
```command
cd osparc-simcore/tests/performance
make install-dev
make .env
```
- start locust
```command
make start
```
- go to http://localhost:8089/ and hit start ... analyze ... hit stop

and this is the projects of one of the fake users:

## What do these changes do?

Outputs produced by a project cannot be retrieved as a file resource in the public-api because their naming is incompatible. This PR overcomes this problem by creating a soft link to the output files with a name compatible with the public api

### storage

- CHANGED: new column ``file_meta_data.is_soft_link: bool``
- CHANGED: refactors routing
- CHANGED: extends testing

### simcore-sdk

title: Avoid empty state while updating work directory in dynamic services

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:pipeline-services
labels.description: issues on non-core services in user's pipeline (use osparc-services repo for specifics)

body:
*Mark from control-core wrote*

You may recall our approach polls for a change in the file in input/input_1 every say .3 seconds. At startup, this file may not exist, and if there is a file exception, our code assumes a default value of zeros to start the simulation.  Later, our code assumes that *only* one of three things happens:  

1. the file is identical to the last time it was read (and so the polling continues)
1. the file's contents have changed (and so the polling stops) or
1. the file has zero bytes because the file has been reopened for write but has not yet been overwritten.   

This assumption is valid when we run the two nodes as processes on our local machine, but apparently not on OSPARC where it appears there is a brief moment when your system removes the old version of the file from input/input_1 before copying the new file from the other node.  This causes the default value of zeros to be inserted in the middle of a simulation, destroying the validity of the result.

title: Disallow saving a non-opened project

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:frontend
labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

body:
## What do these changes do?

When a user forgets a project opened in a laptop, or takes a plane. the project gets disconnected after 15 minutes.
In case he reconnects, the project would save again without being opened in the backend. This cannot be tolerated.

Solution:
when the connect/reconnect event happens in the webscoket, the frontend asks for the active study. If the backend already closed the study, it will return a null. In that case the frontend brings the user back to the dashboard.

related to https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/435

title: zero downtime for upgrades

labels.name: a:infra+ops
labels.description: maintenance of infrastructure or operations (discussed in retro)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: The issue or pull request already exist

body:
- New version is deployed. 
- The deployer updates the stack
- The user gets interrupted because the service is down and sometimes gets a gateway error
    - Instead, the old service should not be shut-down until the new stack is in place

### Possible cause:

The swarm is already configured to have zero downtime per service (i.e. a given service gets turned off ONLY when the new one is started). The problem might be that even if services are ready, the state **between services** is not ready. For example, the new webserver is updated correctly but traffik proxy has still not detected it. That would cause a wrong gateway failure on a front-end request

### Ideas to solve this problem

- Incorporate more conditions on the "healtcheck" validation function (e.g. traffik has discovered all backend services)
- Might be to deploy the entire stack separately first, have a set of rules to validate (e.g. all services healthy, all services connected, traffik routings ready) and then switch.
- Notify the frontend that a new version was deployed https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/issues/2128

title: Fixes aiopg hanging or raising psycopg2.OperationalError suddenly in gh-actions CI

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
## Problem

Some jobs in our gh-actions CI **suddenly** experienced long delays or failures as 
```cmd
    async def cancel():
        self._waiter = create_future(self._loop)
        self._cancelling = True
        self._cancellation_waiter = self._waiter
>       self._conn.cancel()
E       psycopg2.OperationalError: asynchronous connection attempt underway

/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.6.12/x64/lib/python3.6/site-packages/aiopg/connection.py:195: OperationalError
```

Found a [report of a bug in aiopg](https://github.com/aio-libs/aiopg/issues/275 ) with similar behaviour caused by problems resolving the hostname.

Noticed that the VM deployed in gh-actions before and after the problem had just been updated. Checking the ``/etc/hosts`` revealed multiple maps of 127.0.0.1 which *might have* been a reason why aiopg could not resolve it (again a [pr](https://github.com/aio-libs/aiopg/pull/579) in aiopg to address that problem)

## What do these changes do?


Replacing localhost by 127.0.0.1 in all settings related with pg hostname
## How to test

Run all tests and no more jobs hanging or tests raising OperationalError

title: director-v2 should not re-create the pipeline in comp_tasks but update it

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
now the director-v2 does re-create the tasks in comp_tasks on each change of the project pipeline.
This works nicely with computational services, because the table is locked from changes while the computational services are running.

But, this is bad with dynamic services because:
- create a jupyter-lab
- generate some big files in the output (like >300MB)
- put them in one output folder
--> this will trigger the node ports and upload the file

- now modifying the project pipeline
--> triggers an update in the project table
--> director-v2 re-creates the computational tasks in comp_tasks
--> when the node ports finishes the upload the task disappeared.
--> the node ports upload completes and the task has been replaced ... effectively it cannot register the data in the table.

title: Review global exceptions catch within coroutines

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
As can be seen in this [commit], catching ``Exception`` have the risk of suppressing ``CancellationError`` and a code like

```python
# setup
background_task = asyncio.create_task(background_fun)
...
# tear-down
background_task.cancel()
await background_task # <----
```
have the risk of waiting forever.

- Search for broad except in repo, i.e. ``except Exception`` and analyze whether it is
- Review exception handling techniques in asyncio (shield, exception_handler, etc)
- A solution, in case we do not know the exceptions, it to avoid ``CancellationError`` but catch-and-reraise ... but not very elegant. Prefers to catch the right exceptions



[commit]:https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/2079/commits/757ecbcc07b2a3659a6134101a5404b0907b6013

title: comp_task requests are sequentially committed for each node in the project

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:director-v2
labels.description: issue related with the director-v2 service

body:
<!--  **WIP-** prefix in title if still work in progress -->

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Please give a short brief about these changes. -->

**NOTE: Original PR code was scraped as it did not address the issue**

# Issue explained by @sanderegg 

[see original below](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/2043#issuecomment-743018422)

THE only one (service) inserting there is the director-v2. the sidecar/services are only updating.
Therefore, I think the problem is the following:

webclient -> PUT /projects/{uuid}
-> webserver saves project AND sends a /POST /computations/{uuid} to the director-v2
-> director-v2 inserts the new computation by deleting and then inserting
PROBLEM: if you move a node the webclient also triggers a PUT cause the node changed, therefore if the user moves his things/add nodes/modify nodes triggering a lot of PUTs, I think the director-v2 receives a string of requests (which are all async). so my guess is that the director-v2 is still treating the request when a nother arrives.

# Approved implementation proposal:

[see original below](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/2043#issuecomment-743024764)
- I create something similar to the `run_sequentially_in_context` decorator which will be applied to a function responsible for updating each individual node in the project
- This will put calls to this function in a queue which will guarantee FIFO thus applying all the requests from the frontend in sequence.
- The delete recreate logic will still continue to exist and I will remove the upset patter to detect future errors.

## Related issue number

<!-- Please add #issues -->


## How to test

<!-- Please explain how this can be tested. Also state whether this PR needs a full rebuild, database changes, etc. -->


## Checklist

- [ ] Did you change any service's API? Then make sure to bundle document and upgrade version (``make openapi-specs``, ``git commit ...`` and then ``make version-*``)
- [ ] Unit tests for the changes exist
- [ ] Runs in the swarm

title: setInterval in inactive tabs

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:frontend
labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
## Issue description

Considering that:

1. All major browser implementation of the `windows.setInterval()` API creates a slow down if the current tab is not active.
1. Typical user workflow of the oSPARC platform: a user will launch their computation or work on their study with breaks from focusing the browser window (for various reasons).
1. To detect if a user is still connected the backend relies on "heartbeat" calls from the frontend and expects them at regular intervals.

The `setInterval()` period will increase over time surpassing the threshold where the Garbage Collector kicks in to clean the project data. The project will be considered closed at this time and all resources will be removed. This implies that the dynamic services will be closed. This is what happens in https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/375

## Suggested solution

Using a web worker should do the trick. It should be able to provide a proper **timer** which will generate events at regular intervals, fixing the issue.

## Related issues
closes https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-issues/issues/375

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
Open a study in one tab
duplicate that tab -> re-opens the study in a second tab
close the study in the first tab
--> the study gets closed in the backend although the second tab should prevent it from happening

title: BugFix: New fix for access_studies using redlocks

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

body:
<!--  **WIP-** prefix in title if still work in progress -->

## What do these changes do?

- It reimplements the fix using locks to protect construction and initialization of the GUEST user from an eager GC! :-)
- This PR replaces PR#1928  (bugfix for #1853: garbage collector deletes guest users  bug). This implementation avoid setting fictitious resources or anonymous users as in PR #1928. Those proved to be very error prone.
- EXTRA: resources are removed from registry when GC actually executes the clean. This way, the share-lock mechanism will prevent  a user from opening a resource that is being removed [upon request from @odeimaiz and @sanderegg]


## Related issue number

<!-- Please add #issues -->
 Fixes #1853


## How to test

<!-- Please explain how this can be tested. Also state wether this PR needs a full rebuild, database changes, etc. -->
```
make devenv
cd services/web/server
make install-dev
make test-dev-unit
```

title: Do not close/unlock study until it is completely stopped

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
When a user closes a study a tear down process starts.

At the moment, as soon as a user calls study:close and the entry is removed from the active studies database, the study is available again to be opened. Nevertheless, the services in that study need to be properly closed (save state and close).

I propose that the study remains closed/locked until all parts are closed.

title: bugfix for #1853: garbage collector deletes guest users

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
<!--  **WIP-** prefix in title if still work in progress -->

## What do these changes do?

Access to ``/study/{study_id}`` link produces
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32402063/98027429-f132a100-1e0c-11eb-84ac-67914f1335b5.png)

The reason is that the Garbage collector removes GUEST users when they have no resources associated. This caused that temporary GUEST users created in studies access were deleted even before their projects were associated.

This fix overcomes this problem by 
- first creating the user as ANONYMOUS instead of GUEST
- then, once the ``access_study`` is processed, a fictitious socket is created for the socket and it is turn into GUEST

This will prevent the GC to destroy the user before the ``access_study`` handle is completed and some extra time TTL to reconnect.

- [x] Adapted ``pytest tests/unit/with_dbs/fast/test_access_to_studies.py``
- [x] test to demo that an eager GC does not delete user
- cleaned

## Related issue number

<!-- Please add #issues -->
Fixes #1853

## How to test
```cmd
cd services/web
make install-dev
pytest --pdb -s --log-cli-level=DEBUG tests/unit/with_dbs/fast/test_access_to_studies.py
```
and can also see GC log.

## Checklist

- [x] Did you change any service's API? Then make sure to bundle document and upgrade version (``make openapi-specs``, ``git commit ...`` and then ``make version-*``)

labels.description: associated to postgres service and postgres-database package

body:
The metrics is based on data from the DB in simcore.

Since the garbage collector appeared this data is now thoroughly cleaned. the side-effect is that the history of logins disappeared as well.

Proposal:
1. create a metrics from the webserver that prometheus can check,
2. or create a special history table with all the logins

title: Access permissions of a new service version takes priority over older versions

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:catalog
labels.description: catalog service

body:
I am the owner of a service A (v1.0). I publish it and share it with user X. Now user X has access to A v1.0 and he/she loves it!
Then, I decided to add a new feature and publish a new version of service A, therefore is marked as v2.0. 
User X should still have access to A (at least to v1.0, if you like), instead what happens is that user X cannot see anymore service A under discover.
The problem is that the access permission of the newly created service A v2.0 seems to take priority. Since by default, the access is only granted to the owner, it turns out that user X cannot see under discover anymore service A. Not even his beloved v1.0 of A! :-(

I think we should design an access scheme that allows a user X to get all updates of a service A (e.g. everything <= minor updates) once he/she is granted access at any point in time.

title: An eager GC deletes guest users while getting created

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

body:
Prevent GC from deleting guest users while they are being created and assigned a project.

### Tentative solution
- Context manager around study creation that locks GC from deleting a given user. Then when redirection is returned, extend lock a timeout until client connects again the server and the standard TTL process starts.
- As a temporary solution, GC operation interval has been increased in master and staging. P2E shows better results.

<!--  **WIP-** prefix in title if still work in progress -->

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Please give a short brief about these changes. -->

# **Change how computational services are started!!!!**

When the "**Run**" button si pressed on the UI, the `comp_tasks` no longer get deleted, but their `job_id` is set to **NULL** and their `status` is set to **UNKNOWN (int 0)** in the database.




Fixes an issue with the sidecar, which if provided with a zip file in the input it did not decompress it. Now it will automatically decompress it in the same folder and remove the original zip file.

- added logging relative to interactive service startup
- trying to fix [flaky sidecar integration test](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/1826/checks?check_run_id=1151383997#step:9:184)

body:
in ``postgres_db`` fixture at [pytest_simcore/postgres_service.py](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/master/packages/pytest-simcore/src/pytest_simcore/postgres_service.py#L63) **after downgrade call**, User Types remains
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5caef818ecad11531cc41364/70603645-f1cb-47b9-ba32-a873aab041e1)

We temporarly drop_all tables in metadata but this should be instead done by the downgrade instead

``alembic_version`` table is not a problem since it is set to null and upgrade can be applied.


We expect that, starting from an empty db, "upgrade" -> "downgrade" should reach the same empty database

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

body:
## Prerequisites

If user A owns service1 and has previously shared it with user B.

## Scenario
user A has browser open and is logged in
user B has browser open and is logged in and looking at Discover tab
user A removes permission to service1 for user B
user B clicks on the service1:
- unexpected behaviour: **service opens in a new study**
- desired behaviour: **user B is not able to open study**

title: Correctly sync projects between users

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:frontend
labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

body:
While there is some sync when closing and opening the projects between 2 users with an active browser tab opened. Not everything goes smooth.


# Prerequisites
- With a new install have 2 users, one called `neagu@itis.swiss` and one called `tes@test.com`
- Set the role of `neagu` to TESTER in the database.
- Create a group **Z43** from user `neagu` and invite via email `tes@test.com`

# Steps to reproduce

### Working as expected
`neagu` creates a study (**2 sleepers**) with sleeper:2.0.2 and sleeper-gpu:2.0.2
`neagu` shares study **2 sleepers** with `test`
`test` has access to the study but no access to sleeper:2.0.2 and sleeper-gpu:2.0.2 (study will not open)
`neagu` shares sleeper:2.0.2 and sleeper-gpu:2.0.2 with **Z43** (`test` is part of that organization)
`test` can now start **2 sleepers** (study will open)

### Not expected

`neagu` removes sleeper-gpu:2.0.2 from **2 sleepers** and closes the project
`test` opens the unlocked project 
`neagu` and adds sleeper-gpu:2.0.1 to the study and closes the project
`test` tries to open it. It will see the project with a missing study.
`test` exits and reopens the project and will not be allowed to login.

body:
<!--  **WIP-** prefix in title if still work in progress -->

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Please give a short brief about these changes. -->

### Fix failure while recovering ports information
While recovering node port information from the database, the case in which the is missing was never handled. The PR addresses the issue.
Messages on failures will also be sent to the UI for easier debugging in the future.

### Fix uncaught exception
`DatabaseError`was not caught and caused an exception if the pipeline was missing.

### Fix uncaught exception in sidecar pipeline
`DockerError` was never caught. When pulling an image (if the docker registry is not responding) an exception is raised and never handled.

title: Send event to the backend when user closes tab

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:frontend
labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

body:
Referencing https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/1598#issuecomment-655361299

When a user closes the the tab/window it is desirable to inform the backend about this. The event needs to be properly delivered in order to remove the lock when using multiple windows.

[This StackOverflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/52412486/2855718) has an interesting implementation suggestion. I would also use the polyfill.

title: check for GPU in sidecar breaks on non-manager nodes

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: High Priority
labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
The sidecar does a call to:
```docker node inspect```

This fails on non-manager nodes -> therefore the sidecar only runs on the manager node.

Possible alternative to this:
- Try to run the nvidia base example docker container, depending on the result the node can be identified as a GPU node (e.g.: ```docker run nvidia/cuda:10.0-base nvidia-smi``` will fail if the GPU runtime is not set on the node)


References:
Issue:
![Screenshot from 2020-07-05 20-44-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35365065/86539872-61cdbd80-bf00-11ea-936a-ec0a0d87d63f.png)

Location in code:
https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/fb9870f260d9cfe7abed3db92b4d5014a127fe40/services/sidecar/src/simcore_service_sidecar/utils.py#L115

title: monitoring on production shows issues with regard to metrics CPU consumption

labels.name: a:infra+ops
labels.description: maintenance of infrastructure or operations (discussed in retro)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
monitoring on production currently partly fails since the metrics for CPU consumption are using a lot of computational power on prometheus.

Possibilities to improve:
- use a recording rule
- increase memory usage allowed for prometheus (still this should show a problem)
- reduce scraping interval
- save data in a timescaleDB to have less strain on prometheus and a better long-range storage solution

title: Two different clients can edit same study at the same time

labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

body:
When two different users open the same study (I reproduced it by opening the dashboard in two tabs and quickly clicking on the same study in both), the study can be edited by both users without any visible error.

This comes from the PR review https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/pull/1591#pullrequestreview-441561922

A strategy is needed to avoid that situation, that can lead to inconsistent (and maybe corrupt?) studies.

labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.description: a totally crucial bug/feature to be fixed asap

body:
opening a study from portal returns sometimes server error (500)

# Steps to reproduce

- client clicks a link from portal
- link request creating a study as anonymous user
- server creates guest user, copies template and returns redirection with fragment and an encrypted cookie with user credentials
- delete guest user (e.g. emulate garbage collection cleans up after user does not interact)
- client click same study from portal (now request has cookie generated previously)
- server responds with a 500 (Unable to start user session)

body:
python-socketio [release](https://github.com/miguelgrinberg/python-socketio/releases) >=4.4 fail this test

```cmd
pytest --ff services/web/server/tests/unit/with_dbs/test_resource_manager.py::test_anonymous_websocket_connection
```

the test checks that when socket connection is refused  (non-authorized) the server handler ``services/web/server/src/simcore_service_webserver/socketio/handlers.py`` raises an exception that **randomly** reaches the client

See test failure https://travis-ci.com/github/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/jobs/317121817#L1092

These were upgraded dependencies
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5caef818ecad11531cc41364/bc5d0b76-7914-4c1e-97e7-1b1ce00df70f)

title: postgres service drops connection

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:database
labels.description: associated to postgres service and postgres-database package

body:
After a long time of inactivity (idle) a query to the postgres db raises: 
```
psycopg2.OperationalError: server closed the connection unexpectedly
	This probably means the server terminated abnormally
	before or while processing the request.
```
A similar error is reported in aio-libs/aiopg#38. There, they propose to retry upon failure. We created a retry [policy](https://github.com/ITISFoundation/osparc-simcore/blob/master/packages/service-library/src/servicelib/aiopg_utils.py#L124) as well.  Retrying works most of the time but sometimes it does not suffice! 

The question is why the server closed the connection? Looking at the postgres server log, there are no errors. It only report
```
'LOG: could not receive data from client: Connection reset by peer
```
I wonder if this is the reason. According to [this post](https://postgresrocks.enterprisedb.com/t5/PostgreSQL/Connection-gets-reset/m-p/2792/highlight/true#M216) there are at least three possible reasons:
1. Client connection waited/idle for a long time after establishing DB connection and existed unexpectedly.
2. The established connection is not disconnection DB session explicitly
3. In some cases, connection probably died with an out of memory error. (Check if you are getting any out of memory errors in database logs)

title: [bugfix] Delete studies

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:frontend
labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

labels.name: a:webserver
labels.description: issue related to the webserver service

body:
<!--  **WIP-** prefix in title if still work in progress -->

## What do these changes do?

<!-- Please give a short brief about these changes. -->
There was a bug while deleting studies. After deletion, the list of studies was being fetched and the deleted studies where still there.
* Now using ``Promise.all`` to wait for every delete call to resolve before fetching the studies again.
  * This didn't solve the problem, which was caused by the delete endpoint, not waiting for the delete process to finish before sending the response. This caused the front end to try to fetch the studies before they were actually deleted.
* Now the backend stops the services and removes the study's data in parallel but waits for the studies to be deleted from the database before sending a response.

## Related issue number

<!-- Please add #issues -->
#1225 

## How to test

<!-- Please explain how this can be tested. Also state wether this PR needs a full rebuild, database changes, etc. -->
* Try creating several studies and delete them one by one or some at the same time. The list of studies properly updates.

## Checklist

- [x] I think the code is well written
- [ ] Unit tests for the changes exist
- [ ] Documentation reflects the changes
- [x] **Runs in the swarm**
- [ ] If you design a new module, add your user to .github/CODEOWNERS

title: Studies remain visible after deleting them

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:frontend
labels.description: issue affecting the front-end  (area group)

body:
After deleting studies, usually when deleting multiple studies at the same time, one of them remain visible after fetching the list again.
Also, after each deleted study a new call to fetch the studies is issued.
Solution is to create a new API endpoint to delete multiple studies at the same time . A good workaround is to use ``Promise.all()`` to wait for every promise to resolve and then reload the list.

ERROR: for webserver  (<Service: webserver>, "invalid from flag value client/tools/qooxdoo-kit/builder:latest: pull access denied for client/tools/qooxdoo-kit/builder, repository does not exist or may require 'docker login': denied: requested access to the resource is denied")

It would be cool and less time consuming to be able to run ``make build-devel`` without first having to ``make build``.

to enable the token do:
- docker-compose.yaml: edit lines 32, 69, 107
- boot_notebook.sh: replace 
```
    --NotebookApp.token=""  \
    --NotebookApp.disable_check_xsrf='True' \
```
with
```
    --NotebookApp.token="${NOTEBOOK_TOKEN}" \
```

title: CD: webserver was not automatically deployed

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

body:
deployment of osparc staging partially failed after Odei's last PR. All the services were updated but the webserver.

This is due to the fact that the image SHA signature used by the deployer is not the one that is actually deployed but what is on dockerhub.

As the images typically come in at any time, and the redployment process takes some time, it can happen that an image is changed on dockerhub while the portainer is processing the deployment call.

title: sidecar stops working when some running solver never finish

labels.name: bug
labels.description: buggy, it does not work as expected

labels.name: a:sidecar
labels.description: issue related with the sidecar worker service

body:
case appeared when starting a CC 1D solver without input file. The solver seems to be waiting forever.
The sidecar provides a limited amount of workers. If all of them are waiting forever, then nothing new can be started.

Other cases may happen like:
- a solver is in a deadlock
- a solver is doing long and heavy calculations
- a solver is waiting for some file that is not there

Possible ideas:
- kill the solver after a max amount of time
- add a flag for inputs that are required (but may still wait if the format is not correct)
- require a healtcheck function that can find out if the solver is really running

milestone.title: Libra
milestone.description: [Libra](http://www.battlestargalacticamuseum.com/libran/) sprint's main focus user-story is the **EM Neuro w/ structured LF**. Internal review on 09/18/2018 and NIH review on 09/19/2018, both on MR3F

body:
```qx compile --target=build``` in our container is producing an output with errors

![Image Pasted at 2018-9-6 13-32.png.jpeg](https://waffleio-direct-uploads-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/5b3b29951ff11000147eebf7/125516c66e82c728ace21e0d46c1999b2487c3998efaab46a01df180691477227149fa6626c5b27bf211294f1f0119be5d4a1f06a3a3dc78e2a436628f0e08bcd06b0e71c03d40afb0801fbf00ee21da4d8ce3bf9850d2aa6c7bb3d4d216744b470a83ed5c32aa984ecb5ef44ee34b56a5113066f43b.jpeg)

## how-to-reproduce

```bash
cd osparc-simcore/web/server/client
docker-compose build --no-cache
docker-compose run qx compile --target=build
```
- Serve now ``build-output`` folder (if your browser cannot open files, then use e.g. ``python3 -m http.server 8080``)
- in browser add user, password and click logiin ... then error (see above)
